loans.name: Habibullo

texts.ru: Хабибулло женат. Ему 37 лет. У него трое сыновей и одна дочь. Хабибулло вместе с семьей проживает в районе Хамадони. Его жена домохозяйка, а дети школьники. Хабибулло закончил среднее техническое учреждение. Он предприимчивый и добрый мужчина. Хабибулло занимается услугой маршрутного такси. Он шесть лет как занят в этой сфере деятельности. Хабибулло зарабатывает на жизнь за счет услуги такси. Он запрашивает кредит для закупа запасных частей для ремонта своей автомашины, на котором он развозит пассажиров. За счет прибыли с деятельности Хабибулло хочет приобрести цветной телевизор.
texts.en: Habibullo is 57 years old, married and has three sons and one daughter. Habibullo and his family live in Hamadoni region. His wife is a home maker and his chilldren are in school. Habibullo has a technical college degree. He is an enterprising and kind man. Habibullo offers shuttle taxi services. He has worked as a taxi driver for six years and this is his primary means of making a living. He is requesting a loan to purchase spare parts for his taxi cab. Habibullo plans to use the profits from this loan to purchase a color TV for his family.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for repairing his taxi cab

loans.name: Binti

texts.en:
Binti is married. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

She has operated a clothes selling business for the past three years. She sells in a shop to town dwellers, passersby and neighbors. She faces a major challenge of inflation in her business. 

With the 30,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Hawanatu

texts.en: This is 34-year-old Hawanatu. She is married and has one child, who is 18 years old. In 2010, Hawanatu established her grocery shop business. She began her business because she  wanted to assist her husband in their family affairs. Her business is located in the outskirts, and her main customers are all classes of people. Working seven days a week, 12 hours a day, she earns about 700,000 SLL every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of 3,000,000 SLL. Hawanatu requires a loan in order to increase her stock and to earn more profit. In the future, she plans to expand her business, build a house and educate her children. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more items for resale

loans.name: Maria Magdalena

texts.es:
María Magdalena nació en la comunidad de Cotañi y vive en la misma comunidad donde nació, ella tiene 58 años de edad y es casada y fruto de esta hermosa relación tiene un hijo, ella es una persona trabajadora y emprendedora que sale adelante con mucho esfuerzo y trabajo. Su actividad económica principal es la agricultura y tiene varios terrenos donde siembra cebada, avena, habas, etc. Ella también se dedica a la crianza de animales menores como cuyes y gallinas. Desde hace varios años que pertenece al banco comunal “Sumaq Paqari” y en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar más cuyes.  

(La comunidad de Cotañi pertenece al distrito de Huancarani dentro de la provincia de Paucartambo dentro del departamento de Cusco, Perú).
texts.en:
María Magdalena was born in the community of Cotañi and still lives there. She is 58 years old, married, and has one child. María Magdalena is a hardworking and enterprising person who has been able to get ahead with a great deal of effort and work. Farming is her main business activity and she has several plots of land on which she grows barley, oats, beans, and other crops. María Magdalena also raises small animals, such as guinea pigs and chickens. She has been part of the Communal Bank “Sumaq Paqari” for several years and is taking this opportunity to request a loan in order to buy more guinea pigs.

The community of Cotañi is part of the District of Huancarani in Paucartambo Province, Department of Cusco, Peru.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs.

loans.name: Teresa De Jesus

texts.es: Teresa de Jesús vive junto a su compañero de vida y sus 6 hijos, ella se dedica al cultivo de maíz y frijol, tiene muchos años de dedicarse a la agricultura por lo que se ha hecho de mucha experiencia en el rubro, es muy conocida en la zona y ya tiene buena clientela pues obtiene las mejores cosechas, por lo tanto comercia producto de primera calidad y a precios muy accesibles, cuando su cosecha ya esta lista la almacena en los graneros que muestra la fotografia para luego salir a comercializarlos a las agencias que estan cerca de su lugar de residencia, Teresa se caracteriza por su gran amabilidad, es una mujer emprendedora , ella quiere aumentar la producción, pero necesita de un apoyo de capital por eso solicita un crédito que le permita comprar semilla, abonos, fertilizante, herbicidas, etc. Teresa confía que podrá responder a la deuda y al mismo tiempo podrá darle a su familia una vida plena.
texts.en: Teresa de Jesús lives with her life partner and her 6 children. She dedicates herself to the cultivation of maize and beans, and has spent many years of devoting herself to agriculture which has given her great experience in the field. She knows the area well and already has a good clientele because ishe has the best harvests and good prices. When her harvest is ready she sells the grains, showing photography to later go out and sell them to agencies which are near her home. Teresa is characterized by her great friendliness. She is an enterprising woman who wants to increase her production ut needs more capital to support her. This is why she is asking for a loan which will let her buy seeds, fertilizers, herbicides, etc. Teresa confides that she will be able to handle the debt and simultaneously will giver her family a fulfilling life.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer, herbicides, etc.

loans.name: La Manzana Group

texts.es: El grupo "La Manzana" se encuentra conformado por siete integrantes seis mujeres y un hombre ellos mismos eligieron el nombre del grupo, lo decidieron porque el lugar donde viven se llama La Manzana, las personas del grupo son muy trabajadoras pero sobre todo muy emprendedoras, siempren buscan una actividad economica que los ayude a solventar los gastos de su familia. Como Don Ubalado esta solicitando el credito para invertirlo en material para plomeria, Elizabeth invertira en guajolotes para cria y engorda, Martha en frutas y verduras para su venta, Gloria en productos de belleza, Alicia abastecera su tienda de abarrotes, Agustina invertira en productos para uñas. Rebeca quien tambien forma parte del grupo tiene 35 años de edad esta casada con el señor Jose Carmen desde hace cinco años, juntos han formado una familia con dos niños solo uno asiste a la escuela. Doña Rebe, como le llaman, tiene un desayunador que atiende los fines de semana y dias festivos inicio su desayunador desde hace dos años. Esta vez Doña Rebeca esta solicitando su credito para comprar refrescos, jugos, capuchinos que son los productos que más le hacen falta lo que piensa es comprar en cantidades grandes, la señora Rebeca platica que no habia abierto su negocio debido a que sus niños y ella se enfermaron y sus tratamientos fueron muy costosos situcaion que impidio seguir invirtiendo el negocio Doña Rebeca esta muy agradecida con Vision Fund y KIVA porque gracias a los creditos que le han otorgado ha podido comprarse horno de microondas, cafetera, algunas mesas y bancos. El crédito actual le ayudara pues abrirá nuevamente su negocio. El sueño de Doña Rebeca es hacer mas grande su tienda, para poder instalar en la comunidad una libreria o un café internet porque no hay en su comunidad, sin embargo para que Doña Rebeca pueda lograr esto es necesario hacer mas grande su local porque en donde se encuentra actualmente, no tiene tiene la capacidad necesaria para atender a todos sus clientes.
texts.en:
The “La Manzana” group is comprised of seven members, six women and one man.  They selected the name of the group themselves.  They decided on that name because the place where they live is called La Manzana.  The people in the group are very hard-working.  Above all, they are very enterprising.  They always look for a business activity that will help them pay their family expenses.

Ubalado is requesting the loan to invest in plumbing materials.  Elizabeth will invest in turkeys to raise and fatten.  Martha will invest in fruit and vegetables for her sales.  Gloria will invest in beauty products, Alicia will stock her grocery store, and Agustina will invest in nail products.

Rebeca, age 35 and also part of the group, has been married to Jose Carmen for five years.  Together they have made a family with two children, but only one goes to school.  Rebeca has a breakfast business, which she tends on the week-ends and holidays.  She started her breakfast business two years ago.

This time Rebeca is requesting a loan to buy soft drinks, juices, and cappuccinos.  These are the products that she needs the most.  She plans to buy in big quantities.  Rebeca says that she has not opened her business because she and her children got sick.  Her treatments were very expensive.  This situation impeded her continued investment in the business.

Rebeca is very grateful to Vision Fund and Kiva because, thanks to the loans they have granted her, she has been able to buy a microwave oven, a coffee maker, and some tables and benches.  The current loan will help her to open her business once again.

Rebeca’s dream is to make her business larger.  She wants to do this in order to be able to establish a bookstore or an internet cafe because there are none in the community.  However, for Rebeca to be able to manage this she needs to make her place bigger.  The place that she has now does not have to capacity needed to tend to all of her customers.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, juices, and cappuccinos.

loans.name: Maria Concepcio

texts.es: Doña María vive con su grupo familiar en casa propia, ella tiene un negocio de venta de comida y pupusas cerca de su lugar de residencia desde hace varios años con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar los gastos de su hogar. Es una mujer luchadora que su empeño es dar lo mejor de si misma, para que a su familia no le falte lo necesario para la subsistencia. Cuenta con la satisfacción de tener clientela fija ya que esta ubicado en un lugar muy transitado. La clienta desea ampliar su puesto es decir comprar mesas, sillas, más materia prima como: maíz, frijoles, chicharrón, quesillo, carnes, pollos, verduras y todo lo necesario para su negocio y asi tener un poco  mas entrada económicamente, pero no cuenta con los suficientes ingresos para esta inversión, es por eso que se acercó a INTEGRAL para solicitar un crédito y poder comprar lo dicho y así obtener mejores ganancias para tener una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
María lives with her family group in her own house.  She has had a business selling food and ‘pupusas’ [filled, grilled corn cakes] near her house for several year and with profits earned from her sales is able to cover her household expenses.  She’s a hardworking woman who strove to give the best of herself so that her family would have the basics needed to subsist.  She has the satisfaction of having a regular clientele since she’s located at a very busy place.  

She wants to expand her stand, that is to say to buy tables, chairs and raw materials like corn, beans, pork, cheese, meats, chicken, vegetables and everything necessary for her business so her income will improve a bit but she does not have sufficient income for this investment which is why she approached Integral to request a loan to be able to buy said things thus obtaining higher income to have better economic stability.

loans.use: to buy tables, chairs, corn, beans, pork, cheese, meat, chicken and vegetables.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.es: Doña Cecilia de 63 años de edad se dedica a la venta de todo tipo de productos de uso personal como lociones, desodorantes, cremas, talcos entre otras cosas, su negocio lo tiene ubicado en su lugar de residencia con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas y con la ayuda de su esposo logran solventar los gastos de su hogar,  vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus tres hijos, la clienta desea acrecentar su negocio por eso solicita un crédito que le permita poder comprar todo lo necesario como: perfumes, desodorantes y también desea comprar ropa ya que tiene mucha clientela por dar sus productos a precios accesibles, con la ayuda solicitada ella podrá obtener mejores ganancias y así seguirá dándole a su familia lo que necesita sin limitación alguna.
texts.en:
Cecilia, 63, works selling all types of personal use products like lotions, deodorants, creams and talc, among other things.  Her business is located at home and she uses profits from sales and help from her husband to cover her household expenses.  She lives in her own house with her husband and three children.  

She wants to expand the business which is why she’s requesting a loan to be able to buy everything necessary like perfumes and deodorants and she also wants to buy clothes because she has many customers because she sells her goods at affordable prices.  With the requested help she’ll earn higher profits thus continuing to give her family what they need with no limitations whatsoever.

loans.use: to buy lotions, deodorants, creams, talc, etc. and also clothes.

loans.name: Sharif

texts.ru: Шариф умный и трудолюбивый человек. Шарифу 23 года. Он женат, но не имеет детей. Шариф успешно окончил среднюю школу и поступил в Таджикский Государственный Университет Политики и Бизнеса. Шариф учится в факультет Мировой Экономики. Шариф является одним из успешных студентов и активно участвует во всех мероприятиях университета. Он учится во втором курсе. Шариф должен оплатить за учебный договор, но не имеет денег. Он запрашивает займ для оплаты учебного договора. Он ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Sharif is a smart and hardworking man. He is 23 years old and married but has no children. Sharif finished high school with good grades and was accepted to the Tajik State University of Politics and Business. Sharif is getting his degree in International Economics and is one of the best students who also participates in all university activities. He is now a sophomore. Sharif must pay the school's tuition but has no money. He is requesting this loan to pay his tuition. He awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To pay for his tuition

loans.name: Cely

texts.es:
Cely, de 32 años de edad, está casada con Jairo quien trabaja de vigilante y es padre de sus 03 hijos. Juntos viven en su casa propia.Cely alquila su mototaxi a un chofer de la ciudad , este vehículo lo adquirió con el apoyo de su esposo hace más de tres años .Considera a su negocio bastante rentable ya que le genera buenas ganancias.Decidio empezar con este negocio por el deseo de contar con sus propios ingresos económicos y apoyar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar , en el futuro desea contar más vehículos para ponerlos en alquiler.Este será el préstamo número 04 con Kiva y está agradecida y contenta al saber que seguirá contando con el apoyo financiero necesario para avanzar con su negocio. Por otro lado comenta estar a gusto con su banco comunal pues conoce a sus integrantes y los considera personas responsables.
Con el monto solicitado de 600 nuevos soles,comprará repuestos y llantas para dar mantenimiento a su vehículo.
texts.en:
Cely, 32 years old, is married with Jairo, who works as a security guard and is father of 3 children. Together they live in their own home. Cely rents her motorcycle taxi (mototaxi) to be a driver of the city. She got this vehicle with the support of her husband more than three years ago. She considers her business to be very profitable since it makes for good earnings. She decided to start with this business because she wanted to make her own income and support her husband with home expenses. In the future she wants to have more vehicles so that she can rent them to people. This will be the loan number 4 with Kiva, and she is grateful and happy to know that she can continue counting on the financial support she needs to advance forward with her business. Additionaly, she comments that what she likes about her communal bank is that she knows the members and considers them to be responsible people.
With the requested amount of 600 nuevos soles, she will buy spare parts and tires for vehicle maintenance.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and wheels for her mototaxi.

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es: Miguel de 59 años de edad, vive junto a su compañera de vida en casa propia; el posee una tienda donde vende artículos de primera necesidad, frijoles, aceite, golosinas, pan, entre otros, tiene muchos años con su negocio y eso le ha regalado experiencia en las ventas que le permite obtener las mejores ganancias, está ubicada en el lugar de su residencia en una localidad muy transitada, se ha hecho de mucha clientela, porque siempre tiene lo que necesitan con producto de calidad, a precios accesibles y con un servicio inigualable siempre a la orden de los clientes, Miguel es un hombre dedicado a su labor, quiere acrecentar el negocio y realizar una nueva inversión pero necesita de capital por eso solicita un crédito que le permita comprar granos básicos, golosinas, huevos, pan, bebidas, etc. Miguel tiene buenas referencias de pago, asegura que cancelara la deuda y a la vez confía en que le dará a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Miguel, 59, lives with his life companion in his own house.  He has a store where he sells basic staple items like beans, oil, snacks and bread, among others.  He’s had the store for many years so has gained sales experience that allows him to earn the best profits.  It’s located at home in a very busy zone.  He’s acquired a large clientele because he always has quality products they need at affordable prices with unequaled service; he’s always at his customers’ service.

Miguel is a man who is dedicated to his work.  He wants to increase business and make a new investment but needs capital which is why he’s requesting a loan that will make it possible for him to buy basic grains, snacks, eggs, bread, beverages, etc.  Miguel has good payment references and he is sure that he’ll repay the loan while is confident that he’ll provide his family with better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for his store.

loans.name: Amparo Noemi

texts.es: Doña Amparo de 47 años de edad es madre soltera y vive en casa propia junto a su hija de 15 años, Amparo es una madre de familia muy responsable y trabajadora, ha logrado sacar adelante a su familia. Ella posee una tienda desde hace 12 años, ella comercializa productos comestibles como pan, refrescos, aceites, verduras, frutas, golosinas y también de primera necesidad como: jabón y shampoo entre otras cosas tiene su negocio en su casa de habitación. Amparo solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda surtir aún más la tienda de manera que pueda atender mejor a sus clientes y de esta misma forma mejorar sus ventas lo cual es su prioridad para sacar adelante su hogar.
texts.en: Amparo, 47, is a single mother living in her own house with her 15-year-old daughter.  Amparo’s a very responsible, hardworking mother head of household who has managed to move her family forward.  She’s had a store for the last 12 years where she sells foodstuffs like bread, soft-drinks, oil, vegetables, fruit, snacks and also basic need items like soap and shampoo among others.  The store is home-based.  Amparo is asking for a loan to be able to better stock her store so she can offer better customer service and improve sales which is her priority in order to move her household forward.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Maria Carmela

texts.es: Maria de 52 años de edad, vive con su padre, una hermana y su hijo en casa propia; ella posee una tienda donde vende artículos de primera necesidad, frijoles, leche, huevos, pan, entre otros, tiene muchos años con su negocio, está ubicada en el lugar de su residencia, es muy reconocida por los vecinos de la zona , se ha hecho de mucha clientela, pues tiene la tienda surtida, ella quiere acrecentar el negocio y realizar una nueva inversión pero necesita de capital por eso solicita un crédito que le permita comprar lo necesario para su tienda, asegura que cancelara la deuda y a la vez confía en que le dará a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: 52-Year-old Maria lives with her father, a sister and son in her own house. She owns a shop where she sells basic products like beans, milk, eggs, and bread, among others. She has spent many years on this business, which is located in her place of residence. Her shop is very well known by her neighbors in the area and she has a lots of clients because she has a well-stocked shop. She wants to increase business and make a new investment but, she needs capital to be able to buy necessary things for her shop. She assures that she can handle the debt and confirms that she will give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy beans, milk, eggs, bread, oil, sweets, etc

loans.name: Walter Jose

texts.es:
Walter, un joven de 24 años de edad, soltero, habitante de la ciudad de Granada de oficio comerciante se dedica a la venta de ropa nueva, actividad que realiza desde hace 5 años. El tiene un pequeño puesto en la calle, también sale a vender de manera ambulante ofreciendo camisetas, camisas , pantalones para damas y caballeros. A el le gustaría tener un local con mejores condiciones donde exhibir su mercadería para que no la dañe el polvo ni el sol. 
El esta requiriendo el financiamiento para comprar pantalones para dama y caballeros, camisetas, blusas, shorts, faldas. Para aprovechar la temporada alta de las ventas durante el mes de las madres y el crédito le permitirá comprar más estilos de ropas y de esta manera ofrecer variedad aumentar las ventas.
texts.en:
Walter is a young man who is 24 years of age. He is single and resides in the city of Granada. Walter is a merchant who sells new clothing. He has been in this business for five years and has a small retail post on the street. However, he also sells as a traveling vendor by offering T-shirts, shirts, and trousers for women and men. He would like to have a shop with better conditions so that he can display his merchandise without the items getting ruined by dirt or sunlight.

Walter is requesting a loan so that he can buy women’s and men’s trousers, T-shirts, blouses, shorts, and skirts. He would like to take advantage of the high season for sales that occurs during the month for Mother’s Day. The loan will enable him to buy more styles of clothing so that he can offer more variety and increase his sales.

loans.use: to buy women’s and men’s trousers, T-shirts, blouses, shorts, and skirts.

loans.name: Henrry Jimmy

texts.es:
Henrry tiene 22 años de edad y vive en la ciudad de Pilcopata, él es una persona trabajadora y emprendedora que sale adelante. Su actividad económica principal es la agricultura y la venta de madera. Desde hace varios años que pertenece al banco comunal “Chacoq” y en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar más madera. 
(La ciudad de Pilcopata es la capital del distrito de Kosñipata dentro de la provincia de Paucartambo dentro del departamento de Cusco, Perú).
texts.en:
Henrry, 22, lives in the city of Pilcopata.  He's a hardworking and enterprising person who gets ahead.  His main job is farming and selling wood.  He has belonged to Chacoq Communal Bank for several years.

He needs the current loan to buy more wood.

(The city of Pilcopata is the capital of the district of Kosñipata in the province of Paucartambo in the department of Cusco, Peru.)

loans.use: to buy wood

loans.name: Tito Santos

texts.es: Tito de 48 años de edad es un hombre muy trabajador quien vive junto a su señora esposa y su hijo. Él posee un negocio de transporte Express a través de 2 vehículos que son de su propiedad, gracias a este trabajo es como él puede costear los gastos de su hogar y perseguir sus sueños y metas, aunque también tiene su negocio aparte el cual consiste en la venta de lácteos que es donde su esposa le ayuda lo cual le genera ganancias extras a aparté de los viajes, don Tito solicita un crédito por medio del cual pueda invertir en repuestos y mantenimiento para su vehículo para seguir con los negocios.
texts.en: Tito is a 48-year-old is a man who is a hard worker and lives with his wife and son. He owns a business of express delivery through two vehicles that that he owns. Thanks to this work he can pay for the cost of home expenses and pursue his dreams and goals, but he also has a separate business which consists of the sale of milk. His wife helps him to make extra profits with this apart from the travelling. Tito requests this loan to invest in spare parts and maintenance for his vehicle and to continue the business.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and fix his vehicle.

loans.name: Dúo Lluvia De Gracia Group

texts.es: Dúo Llivia de gracia este grupo esta conformado po la señora Norfa Natalia de 50 años de edad ella se dedica a la venta de productos por catalogo desde hace varios años, en esta oportunidad esta solicitando la ayuda de kiva ya que nececita inverti un poco mas para generar mejores ganancias esta solicitando este credito para la compra de mercaderia en produtos por catalogo.
texts.en: Dúo Llivia de gracia is a group made of Norfa Natalia, who is 50 years old and dedicates herself to selling products through a catalogue. She's done this for several years, and is asking for the help of Kiva to invest a bit more and make better earnings. She is asking for this loan to buy merchandise though catalogue products.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Azucena

texts.es:
Azucena, de 40 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y empeñosa, además de ser alegre y sociable. Esta casada con Enel quien es empleado y padre de sus 02 hijos a quienes quieren mucho. Juntos están cómodamente instalados en su casa propia.La actividad que realiza Azucena es el servicio comida para los trabajadores de las distintas empresas madereras de las zona.Se inició en éste negocio hace más de 01 año con un capital propio, y hasta el momento lo realiza sola.
Ahora observando los buenos resultados que está teniendo, tiene planeado incursionar en otro negocio que ha visto rentable está es la venta de ropas.Este será el préstamo número 05 con Kiva y está agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para continuar con su negocio.Con el monto solicitado de 2500 nuevos soles los invertirá en la compra de víveres tales como arroz , carnes , verduras y otros productos que usa en la preparación de comidas para dar pensión a sus trabajadores en las labores de llenado de hornos para secado de madera.
texts.en:
Azucena, 40, is a hardworking, enterprising woman in addition to being cheerful and sociable.  She’s married to Enel who is employed and the father of their two children they love very much.  They are comfortably installed in a house they own.  The activity Azucena does is providing food for employees in various lumber yards in the zone.  She started the business over a year ago with her own capital and to date works alone.

Seeing the good results she’s been having, she plans to go into another business that she deems profitable: clothing sales.  This will be her fifth Kiva loan and she’s grateful for the financial support she gets to stay in business.

She will use the requested 2,500 soles to buy foodstuffs like rice, meat, vegetables and other products used to prepare the meals she caters to the workers who load the lumber drying ovens.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like rice, meat and vegetables.

loans.name: Jehad

texts.en:
Jehad is a 27-year-old, married man. He is the father of two daughters. 

To be able to support his family, Jehad opened a small store where he sells cooking gas containers. He is known around the neighborhood since everyone gets their gas from him.  

Now, Jehad is applying for a youth loan to expand the shop and increase the number of containers he has to cover, serving more areas than what he is covering now.

loans.use: to expand the shop and increase the number of cooking gas containers he has to service.

loans.name: Teddy

texts.en:
Teddy is a photojournalist for the Army who is originally from Panama. He launched his own photography and DJ business in 2003. The company is based in Maryland. Teddy is married, and he and his wife have a young son.

In his part time, Teddy takes photos at weddings, birthday parties and other events. His other passion is to DJ. Teddy learned how to DJ from his friends while growing up in Panama. 

Teddy is requesting a loan of $8,500 to pay for DJ and photography equipment. In the future, he hopes to expand his business into a one-stop shop for photography, DJ, video production and multimedia services.

loans.use: to pay for DJ and photography equipment

loans.name: Duran

texts.en:
Duran has two goals: to graduate from college and to be his own boss. He is accomplishing both of his dreams. He started a commercial cleaning business five years ago and managed commercial cleaning contracts part-time while working on his accounting degree at Southern University. Last year, he incorporated and renamed his business to A. Commercial Cleaning Inc. He graduates from college at the end of the year.

Duran said while he initially started the business to finance college and to fit work into his school schedule, he has big plans to grow his business once he graduates.

“To be honest, I like what I do,” Duran said. “I've been doing this for five years and we've started growing a lot. We're in the process of getting an office set up. Our goal is to be operating at least 100 cleaning contracts.”

Currently, Duran manages 15 cleaning contracts and employs two workers full-time and three part-time. He plans to hire five more part-time workers, but hopes someday to hire at least 50. He said what distinguishes his business from others is the follow-through and quality control.

“What separates us from other businesses is that we are very proactive with what we do,” Duran said. “We have a field manager. And the field manager does drop in on a job to make sure the cleaning is up to par. And if there is a problem, he fixes it right then and there. Our belief is that we want to catch a problem before you do.”

To expand his services, Duran needed to buy a carpet cleaner and a floor buffer for his business but didn’t have the capital up front. He learned about Accion Louisiana – Accion Texas’s branch in Baton Rouge – from the Louisiana Small Business Development Center. 

“It was a great experience, working with Accion,” Duran said. “I will refer as many people as possible to them.”

Duran said he is excited about finishing his degree. And while he acknowledges he could get a job in corporate America with his college degree, he said he prefers to be an entrepreneur. “I love being my own boss,” Duran said. “You have to work very hard, but I love the freedom it has offered me.”

loans.use: to buy a carpet cleaner and a floor buffer

loans.name: Mabel

texts.en:
Mabel is in her late twenties and married with two children. She runs a food stand in Kandeh town Bo, Southern area in Sierra Leone. She went into business in order to help her husband to educate the children and take good care of the home.

She's been in this business for four years and sells palm oil, 'gari' (cassava grits), rice and cooking seasonings within a busy market area.  Her business is going on well, having new customers every day. 

Mabel requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase more food items such as palm oil, gari, rice and cooking seasonings. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her increase her business and open a savings account. In the future, she would like to open a shop. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more food such as palm oil, 'gari', rice and cooking seasonings.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy tables, chairs, rice, chicken, meat, beans, fruit, vegetables, etc.

loans.name: Rugiatu

texts.en:
This is 35-year-old Rugiatu. She is divorced and has two children, aged 7 and 13. She has one additional dependent, who lives with her to help with the house chores. In 2005, Rugiatu established her provisions, drinks, toiletries and cooking condiments business. She began her business because wants to be self-reliant after being divorced by her husband. Her business is located in the outskirts, and her main customers are all ages and sexes. Working seven days a week and 12 hours a day, she earns about 2,977,700 SLL (Sierra Leone leones) every month from this business. 

She would like a loan in the amount of 4,000,000 SLL. Rugiatu requires a loan in order to pay for additional maggi seasoning, sugar, salt, biscuits and laundry soap. She hopes that this loan can increase the stock and improve the profit. In the future, Rugiatu plans to improve the business and raise enough profit. She hopes to be able to open a shop in the center of town. She started the business in a stall, now she has expanded the business to a shop. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to pay for maggi seasoning, sugar, salt, biscuits and laundry soap.

loans.name: Kihayura Twekambe Group

texts.en:
Paulina is 60 years old. She has eight children, including two who are still at school.She is a peasant farmer who grows mainly cassava, maize, beans and ground nuts for both home consumption and commercial purposes so as to raise money for paying school fees.

Paulina was funded with a loan of ugx.200,000 UGX in the previous cycle which helped her to pay school fees for her children for that term and the balance was used for planting maize. Paulina has now approached Ugafode requesting a loan of ugx.300,000 UGX to help her buy seedlings of maize and ground nuts that she will plant during this rainy season. She intends to use the returns of the harvest to pay tuition for her children.

Her dream is to see the children complete university, however her challenge is the limited capital used in agriculture which is not yielding enough to pay school fees and other household expenses. She is a hard working lady but is hindered by those challenges.

(Paulina just like Yoweri acquired a loan during the previous cycle, however we have decided to interview Paulina not Yoweri this cycle for purposes of diversity since there are many members in the group.)

loans.use: To buy maize and beans, for planting and for sale

loans.name: Deborah

texts.en:
Deborah is 38 years, married and has four children who attend school.  She is from Paynesville, which is a suburb of the capital of Monrovia.  It is one of areas in Montserrado County with the highest population and best standard of living.  There are good roads, access to water, affordable rents, and many transportation options in the area. 

Deborah owns her own table business, which she has been doing for 10 years.   She began operating her business with her husband's help. She is requesting a loan, which she will use to buy flour, oil, sugar, pepper, etc. for her business. In her business, she faces transportation issues.  Her favorite part of her business is the profit she makes. In the future, she hopes to own a house.

loans.use: to purchase flour, oil, sugar, pepper, etc.

loans.name: Kadie

texts.en:
Kadie is 32 years old and married with 4 children and two additional relatives at home. She runs a Food standing business in Moribatown BO in Sierra Leone.

She's been in this business for 17 years and sells pepper, onions, nut oil and cooking season within a busy market.  Kadie says that the major problem she is facing is the perishable goods spoil if the sale is slow. 

Kadie requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase more cooking items like pepper, onions, nut oil and cooking season. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her renovate her house and take care of her children welfare. In the future, she would like to expand her business to a shop level. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more cooking items like pepper, onions, nut oil and cooking season.

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en:
Theresa is 38 years old, and she resides in Paynesville South, a suburb just outside Monrovia. The area is one of the most populated areas in Montserrado County, with one of the best standards of living in the country. Good roads, access to clean water, affordable rents and plentiful transportation options make Paynesville South one of the most popular places to live.

She is a single with three children, aged between 18 and 4, who live at home and attend school. She is a high school graduate. For the past five years, she has been selling used clothes in the local market. She started this business with money given to her by her mother. She enjoys her business because the business gives her more money. She sells six days a week, from 7 a.m. to  5 p.m., and most of the time, she uses a taxi to get her goods to her shop. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase more used clothes for her business. Her plan is to build a house and educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase more used clothes for her business.

loans.name: Geofrey

texts.en:
Geofrey is a married man, age 35 with 7 children, 5 of whom are attending various schools. He is a businessman who deals in farm supplies, with a shop at Gunda Trading Centre. He says he works 7 days a week. He raises cattle and this brings him some side income.

He started this business in the year 2009 and he says it has been prosperous. He says that the reason he started this business is to take care of his family, and he has acquired this loan to buy more items/stock for the business so as to expand it. He says that his main clients are from the community in which he stays and neighbours.
Geofrey faces the challenges of bad debtors and the lack of enough funds to expand his business. He describes himself as a hardworking man.

loans.use: To buy items for sell in the retail shop

loans.name: Santos Manuel

texts.es: Santos de 30 años de edad se dedica  a la venta de arena, piedra y tierra desde hace varios años, vende principalmente con los albañiles y con los comercios de materiales para construcción que están cerca de la zona donde reside, santos esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de dos bueyes ya que usa una carreta que es la que muestra la fotografía para poder llevar los materiales a los diferentes lugares que le soliciten y asi poder tener a sus clientes satisfechos y pueda obtener mejores ganancias para darle a su familia una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Santos is 30 years old and has been selling sand, stone, and dirt for several years. He sells primarily to bricklayers and to merchants who offer construction materials near the area where he lives.

Santos is requesting a loan to buy two oxen for pulling the cart that is shown in the photograph. This will enable him to deliver requested materials to different places so that he will have satisfied customers. As a result, he will be able to generate more income to provide better financial stability for his family.

loans.use: to buy two oxen for pulling a cart used to transport construction materials.

loans.name: Katwebumbe Youth Group

texts.en: Winnie, a single mother of 2 children, is a member of Katwebumbe group. She lives in a rented house in the outskirts of the city and is engaged in making clay stoves. From the business, she gets money to pay her tuition, meet her basic needs, and pay rent for the house. Her main clients are business people from neighboring areas and traders from the city. She is hard working and committed to repaying her loan and maintaining the membership of the group as a group leader.The photo comprises of 7 members because two of the group leaders are not borrowing this cycle (the man in the centre with a striped t-shirt is the group secretary while the one next to him from the left is the group advisor,Winnie is the second from the the right.All the members signed waiver forms.

loans.use: To buy firewood for burning clay, and to hire laborers.

loans.name: Margret

texts.en:
Margret is married, with four children. Currently, she has one child who is at being educated at the university level. Her husband has a mental health problem and he is currently indoors at home. This meant that Margret had to uphold all the responsibilities at home. To look after her family, she is into farming as the major source of income.

Margret wants a loan of UGX 500,000/=(five hundred thousand shillings) to pay tuition fees for her daughter at the university, so that she registers and sits for her last exams of the second year. She has paid half of the tuition and getting a loan is the only way to raise the balance. 

Her dream is to see her daughter complete her education and maybe, get a job, so that the burden of looking after their father and the family is shared. Her main challenge has always been the limited resources where she has to pay tuition for her daughter and at the same time meet the family basic needs. In the photo is the client and the Ugafode credit officer in a red skirt(right to left)

loans.use: To help pay her daughter's university tuition.

loans.name: Cecilio

texts.es: Cecilio, tiene 49 años de edad, es soltero, tiene 5 hijos, vive con su hijo, nuera y dos nietos en una aldea del municipio de Intibucá. Desde joven se dedico a la agricultura al cultivo de maíz y frijoles y a la albañilería y  hace 27 años logro establecer su propio taller de ebanistería donde elabora puertas, ventanas, muebles de cocina, mesas, sillas, roperos etc. El taller lo tiene en su casa y sus clientes son de la comunidad. El ha decidido por un préstamo de 25,000 Lempiras para comprar madera, barniz, pinturas y otros materiales para la fabricación de muebles que tiene pendientes por terminar. Su meta es ahorrar para su futuro hijo y su familia.
texts.en:
49-year-old Cecilio is single and has five children.  He lives with his son, daughter-in-law and two grandchildren in a small village in Intibucá.  He has been farming since he was young, growing corn and beans, and also doing building work.  27 years ago he managed to set up his own furniture-making workshop where he makes doors, windows, kitchen cabinets, tables, chairs, wardrobes, etc.  His workshop is located in his home and his customers come from his community.

Cecilio has decided to take out a loan for 25,000 lempiras to buy wood, varnish, paints and other materials for making some pieces of furniture that he needs to finish.  His goal is to save for his future, his son and his family.

loans.use: to buy wood, varnish, paints and other materials for making furniture

loans.name: Kupha

texts.en:
Kupha is 57 years old. She makes a living selling mainly fruits and vegetables, which she has been doing for more than three years. She has a place in a popular market in Samburu where she sells fresh products to her customers every day.

Kupha is requesting a loan, which she will use to buy fruits and vegetables so she can continue working and giving her customers good products. She is a very hardworking person who makes an effort every day.

loans.use: to purchase fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Pacifique

texts.en: Pacifique is 25 years old. She sells clothes, which she has been doing for two years. She is requesting a loan, which she will use to buy more shirts and trousers for men to sell. The profits from the business will be used to renovate her house.

loans.use: to purchase shirts and trousers to sell.

loans.name: Araly

texts.es: doña araly vive en casa propia con sus esposo, ella posee un tienda en su residencia desde hace varios años vende golosinas, aceite, huevos, refrescos, etc. tiene mucha clientela pues vende todos sus productos a buen precio, es una persona muy amable y trabajadora, doña araly esta solicitando un credito para poder surtir su tienda con mas productos para satisfacer a su clientes y ella pueda obtener mejores ganancias para tener una mejor estabilidad economica con su esposo.
texts.en: Araly lives in her own house with her husband.  She has had a store at home for several years where she sells snacks, oil, eggs, beverages, etc.  She has a large clientele because she sells all her products at affordable prices.  She’s a very kind, hardworking person.  Araly’s asking for a loan to be able to stock her store with more products to meet customer demand and earn higher profits so she and her husband can have better economic stability.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store..

loans.name: Mirian Elizabeth

texts.es: Miriam se dedica a la venta de ropa y artículos para bebe como sobrefundas, pañaleras, gorritos, sabanas, etc. Desde ya hace varios años y cuenta con muchos clientes fijos con lo que puede mantener su negocio a flote. Con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas logar cubrir algunos gastos de su hogar, ella vive con sus dos hijos y su esposo en casa propia,  Miriam  solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad de ropa  ya que posee gran demanda por parte de muchas personas, con lo que podrá adquirir en diferentes precios, estilos y colores y de esta forma contar con más clientes y así mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en: Miriam sells clothes and other items for babies, such as pillowcases, diaper bags, little hats, sheets, etc. She has done this for several years and she has many regular customers so that she is able to keep her business afloat. With the revenue she earns from her sales, she can cover some household expenses. She lives with her two children and her husband in their own home. Miriam is requesting a loan with which she can purchase wholesale some clothes, because she has great demand from many people. With this loan, she could buy clothes at a variety of prices in different styles and colors so that she can get more customers and improve her quality of life.

loans.use: purchase baby items such as pillowcases, diaper bags, little hats, sheets, etc.

loans.name: Maria Lucia

texts.es: María vive con su esposo y su hija en casa propia, ella es una mujer muy responsable y quien tiene como prioridad principal salir adelante. Ella posee una venta de tortillas, en la cual se encarga de elaborar cada mediodía y cada noche. Su negocio esta ubicado en su casa de habitación en el que desea mucho poder mejorar, ya que este brinda ganancias muy estables, lo cual le permite sostener a su familia, es por esto que solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda comprar maíz por mayor y cal, esto para elaborar mayor cantidad de tortillas, sobretodo los fines de semana que su demanda se incrementa debido a que muchas otras tortillerías están cerradas y así ella pueda obtener mayores ganancias las cuales le permitan mejorar su estabilidad económica.
texts.en: María lives with her husband and their daughter in her own home. She is a very responsible woman whose top priority is to succeed and move ahead. She has a tortilla-selling business for which she bakes every afternoon and evening. Her business is located in her home, and she very much wants to be able to improve it because this generates very stable revenue which allows her to support her family. This is why she is requesting a loan so that she will be able to purchase corn wholesale as well as lime. This is to make larger quantities of tortillas. Above all, the weekends are when her demand picks up because many of the other tortilla shops are closed, so she is able to generate better revenue, which allows her to improve her economic stability.

loans.use: purchase corn wholesale as well as lime

loans.name: Mohammed

texts.en:
Mohammed is a 21 year old who lives in Sana`a, Yemen. He started a pharmacy business a few years ago, working together with his sister. He has a bachelor's degree. There is a big need for his type of business.

Mohammed is a good-natured man who says, "I would like to develop the business activity by purchasing products in large quantities for economic reasons.” He would like to expand his business to offer different services for his clients. The total loan he is requesting is 200,000 Yemen Rials (YER) to buy electronic medical instruments. He hopes to grow his business in the coming years.

loans.use: to buy electronic medical instruments so that he can offer different services for his clients.

loans.name: Maria Del Transito

texts.es: Doña María de 43 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y su hijo, ella se dedica a la venta de cocos en un puesto que tiene en un mercadito cerca de su lugar de residencia ya tiene mucha clientela pues vende sus productos a un buen precio, con las ventas que realiza logra obtener buenas ganancias que le sirven para cubrir los gastos de su hogar y otras necesidades que se le puedan presentar, Doña María solicita un crédito para poder comprar los cocos por mayor ya que últimamente ha tenido mucha demanda y obtener mejores ganancias para darle a su familia un mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: María, 43 years old, lives in her own home with her husband and their son. She sells coconuts from a stand that she has at a little market near her home, and she has many customers because she sells her products at a good price. With the sales she has made, she has earned good revenue that has helped her cover household expenses and pay for other necessities as they arise. Maria is requesting a loan to be able to purchase coconuts wholesale since, recently, she has had so much demand, and generating better revenue would allow her to give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase coconuts for selling their water.

loans.name: Mahir

texts.en: Mahir is an IDP (internally displaced person) from Kalbadjar. Now Mahir lives in Absheron region with his family. Mahir is 45 years old, married, and has three children, a daughter and two sons. His daughter goes to college and his sons go to university. He wants his daughter to become a teacher. His wife stays at home, so he is the only one making an income. He started his business 10 years ago to sell food production. Now Mahir needs a 2,000 AZN loan to buy a deep freeze for his shop, because it's getting warm and the products deteriorate rapidly. He wants to use the money from his expanded business to help his family. In the future, Mahir wants to repair his workshop. This will be more profitable for his business. He is thankful to Komak and Kiva for supporting him.

loans.use: to buy a deep freeze

loans.name: Fresia Roxana

texts.es:
Fresia es una mujer de 21 años, es soltera, vive en la ciudad de Nazca con sus padres y hermanos, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta que tiene un gran deseo de superación; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad que tiene de trabajar, Fresia no ha podido estudiar una carrera profesional, pero gracias a su deseo por salir adelante pudo estudiar cursos técnicos de Computación, en sus ratos libres le gusta distraerse viendo televisión y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Pollo a la Brasa para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Fresia trabaja brindando atención al público en una minimarket de su ciudad, ella trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 8 horas y cree que le va bien por su buen desempeño y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Fresia se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá cubrir los gastos del mejoramiento y pago de mano de obra de las refacciones que desea realizar en su vivienda, como refuerzo de paredes y pintado, de esta manera ella y su familia tendrán mayor seguridad y bienestar, así pues ella seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de poder estudiar una carrera profesional.
texts.en:
Fresia, 21, is single living in the city of Nazca with her parents and siblings.  She’s a very kind, hardworking, enthusiastic person who very much wants to improve.  Unfortunately, owing to lack of economic resources and the need she has to work, Fresia has been unable to study a professional career but thanks to her drive to get ahead she was able to take technical courses in computing.  She likes to watch television in her free time and sometimes cooks a delicious charcoal grilled chicken to share with her family.

On her own initiative and with much effort and dedication, Fresia’s been working providing customer service in a minimarket in her city.  She works every day for about 8 hours and believes she does well because of the good way she does her work and the kind way she treats others.

Fresia’s very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to the support provided she will be able to cover costs and labor costs to do some home improvements she wants like refurbishing the walls and painting.  In this way, she and her family will have greater security and well-being and she can continue working and striving towards attaining her great dream: to study a professional career.

loans.use: to do some home repairs.

loans.name: Dieudonne

texts.en: Dieudonne is 31 years old. He is married with one child aged two. He works as a motorcyclist. He has spent four years in the business. With the loan, he wants to repair his motorcycle in order to be in a good condition. The profits from the motorcycling will be used to build a house.

loans.use: To repair his motorcycle in order to have a better condition for use in transport.

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.en:
Mohamed is married and has seven children, two of whom attend school and five of whom are adults. He has operated a fish selling business at the market for the past two years, selling to town dwellers and neighbors. 

Mohamed is requesting a loan from Yehu, which he will use to purchase bundles of fish, cooking oil, and firewood. He decided to join Yehu to access loans at lower cost to improve his business. He faces a major challenge of the high cost of purchasing fish especially during cold currents in the deep sea. He owns a house that has electricity and piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of fish, cooking oil, and firewood.

loans.name: Jhonny

texts.es: Jhonny, es un muchacho muy joven ,vive en concubinato, tiene dos hijos a los cuales ayuda en sus estudios y alimentación, quiere salir adelante trabajando  junto con su de su pareja para tener un futuro mejor, para  eso necesita mucha ayuda económica es por eso que solicita crédito. Actualmente vive en su casa de sus padres, Johnny  no pudo continuar con sus estudios por motivo problemas familiares, entonces sus padres tambien ya no le ayudaron en sus estudios.  pero el joven  es trabajador lo comentan sus amigas y vecinos de la zona donde vive, por ahora trabaja como moto taxista,  sin embargo desea comprar su propia moto para trabajar mejor y tener mejores ingresos, el muchacho tiene sueños de comprar con sus ahorros un chaco para tener plantaciones de palmito y otros cultivos y con eso puede salir adelante, necesita  mucha ayuda económica para mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Johnny is a young man who is in a common-law relationship.  He has two children, so he helps with providing them an education and food.  Johnny wants to move forward along with his partner so that they can have a better future.  He needs a great deal of financial assistance, which is why he is requesting this loan.  

Johnny currently lives at his parents’ house and is not able to continue his studies because of family problems.  His parents are not able to help him with his studies.  According to his friends and neighbors who live in the area, he is a hard worker.  For now Johnny works as a motorcycle taxi driver.  However, he wants to buy his own motorcycle so that he can do a better job and have more income.  He dreams of using his savings to buy a farm where he can grow palm trees and other crops so that he can get ahead.  Johnny is in great need of financial assistance so that he can improve his income.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Jisele

texts.en: Jisele is 34 years old.  She specializes in selling clothes and bed sheets and has been in this business for four months since shifting from selling fabrics.  With the loan, she wants to add more bed sheets for sale.  The profits from the business will be used to renovate the house.

loans.use: to buy more clothes and bed sheets for sale.

loans.name: Carlos Rafael

texts.es:
Carlos tiene 31 años de edad, esta casado y tiene dos hijos. Cuenta con 8 años de trabajar en la agricultura y fue su padre quien le enseño. Para comprar los insumos agrícolas debe desplazarse aproximadamente a tres horas de su casa. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar abono, fertilizantes, pesticidas, herbicidas, preparar el terreno para cultivar 17,500 metros cuadrados de yute y 7,000 metros cuadrados de maíz. Estos cultivos le servirán para generar ingresos que permitan brindar salud, educación, alimentación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Carlos is 31 years old, married, and has two children. He has been farming for eight years and learned this trade from his father. In order to buy farming supplies, he must make a three-hour trip from his home.

The loan he is requesting from Fundación Campo will be used to buy compost, fertilizers, pesticides, and herbicides so that he can prepare his land for cultivation. He plans to grow 17,500 square meters of jute and 7,000 square meters of corn. These crops will generate income so that he can provide health care, education, and food for his children.

loans.use: to buy compost, fertilizers, pesticides, and herbicides.

loans.name: Jose

texts.en:
Jose is 59 years old and lives in Sinara Bajo, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. He is married and has four children.

Jose is engaged in a snack vending business and earns approximately PHP 3,000 each month doing this type of work. He has requested a loan to purchase more raw ingredients for his snack vending business. Jose has been a member of PMPC for one year. In the future, he hopes to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase more raw ingredients for his snack vending business.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is married and has six children who attend school.  She is from Samburu. Her husband is an electrician.  Amina runs a small and well-furnished food store in her neighborhood, which she has been doing for two years. She has established customers and is well-known thanks to the variety of products she offers to her customers. 

Amina is requesting a loan, which she will use to  buy vegetables, wheat flour, maize flour, bulk items, and other merchandise, in order to continue offering her customers a good variety of products. She wants to keep on investing in her store in the future.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables, wheat flour, maize flour, bulk items, and other merchandise.

loans.name: Viktor

texts.en:
Viktor, 41 years old, lives in the Rustavi district with his wife and nine-year-old son. He has requested loans from local financial institutions several times for a business start-up but without any success. His loan requests were all rejected because of his low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

The family runs an agricultural business. They own a plot where potatoes are grown and have bee hives. The honey is sold at local markets, and the family earns a small monthly income.

Viktor requested a loan from Credo to start a business. He has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program helps rural poor people who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor are regarded as “high-risk borrowers” because of their low income. 

With his loan, Viktor will purchase a crane truck. He will hire a driver or sometimes drive it himself to provide services. These trucks are used for fixing street lights, putting up advertising banners and for things people can’t reach with a ladder. Not many of these trucks exist in Viktor's district, so he will have a lot of orders and will earn a good profit. This will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: To purchase a crane truck.

loans.name: Anatalia

texts.en:
Anatalia is 60 years old and married, with six children. She is from Katipunan, Sinacaban. For 17 years, Anatalia has owned and operated a general store where she sells a variety of products to earn a living.  

She is now requesting a 22,000 PHP loan to purchase additional stock. In the future, she wants to improve her business to generate more income in order to further her children’s education.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock for her general store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to service and repair his motorcycle.

loans.name: Jackeline Andrea

texts.es:
Andrea de 22 años es una joven estudiante de Derecho en la universidad.
Andrea ha pedido su segundo  préstamo para continuar con sus estudios, Andrea usara este préstamo para pagar su matrícula y empezar sus clases de ingles, le falta 02 años para terminar su carrera y lo que más desea es culminarla con éxito, se especializara en derecho penal porque siente que es su vocación, por otro lado continua trabajando en la venta de tubérculos que es un ingreso necesario para poder solventar los gastos de su hijo. Andrea esta agradecida por este nuevo préstamo ya que gracias a el podrá continuar con sus sueños a los inversionistas Kiva les quiere decir: “Gracias por confiar en nosotros!”
texts.en: Andrea, 22, is a young law student at the university. She’s asking for her second loan to continue with her studies.  Andrea will use this loan to pay her tuition and to start her English classes.  She has two years to go to finish her career and what she wants most is to complete it successfully.  She will specialize in penal law because she feels that’s her vocation.  On the other hand, she continues working selling tubers which is a necessary income in order to cover her son’s expenses.  Andrea is grateful for this new loan because she’ll be able to continue with her dreams thanks to it.  She’d like to say to Kiva lenders: “Thanks for trusting us!”

loans.use: to pay tuition fees and to pay for her English course.

loans.name: Edgar

texts.en:
Edgar is 46 years old and lives in Map-an, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. He is married and has three children.  Edgar is engaged in the motor cab for hire business and earns approximately PHP6,000 each month doing this type of work. He has requested a loan to purchase more equipment to repair their motor cab. 
Edgar has been a member of PMPC for almost one year. In the future, Edgar hopes to engage in other types of business.

loans.use: To purchase more equipment for repairing their motor cab

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase a variety of clothes, such as skirts, slacks, blouses, shirts, suits, etc.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is 51 years old and lives in Maloro, Tangub City. She is married with five children. 

Virginia has a shop that sells eggs. She had this business for almost two years. She requested a loan to help purchase additional trays of eggs for retail. Virginia would like to expand her business by increasing the inventories.

Virginia has been a member of PMPC for four years. In the future, Virginia hopes to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase eggs for her business.

loans.name: Jaime

texts.en:
Jaime is 61 years old and lives in Basirang, Tudela. He is widowed with two children. 

Jaime is a government employee and earns approximately PHP 10,000 each month doing this type of work. Aside from being a Government Employee, he owns a farm for additional income. He oversees and manages his men who works for him. For another cropping season, he has  requested a loan to purchase additional fertilizers. 

Jaime has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, Jaime hopes to provide his family's daily needs.

loans.use: to purchase additional fertilizers

loans.name: La Amistad Group

texts.es: El grupo “LA AMISTAD” está conformado por 6 mujeres empeñosas quienes se encuentran pasando el séptimo ciclo. Maria tiene 38 años es conviviente con 3 hijos aun educando. Maria se dedica al tejido hace varios años con el cual ha podido ayudar a su esposo con los gastos y educación de sus hijos. Maria distribuye las prendas que teje a los comerciantes de ropa. En sus tiempos libres se dedica a cocinar en eventos festivos y a pedido de sus clientes. El préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de lanas para elaborar chompas y guantes. Su mayor deseo es tener un stand donde pueda ofrecer sus tejidos. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas 	KIVA por el préstamo otorgado. Maria es la primera del lado derecho.De la misma manera se encuentra adherida la foto de Valeria en la parte superior derecho que no puedo estar presente en la reunión por motivos de salud.
texts.en:
The “La Amistad” (Friendship) group consists of six enterprising women who are starting the seventh cycle.  María’s 38-year-old has a spouse and three children attending school.  She’s been working knitting for several years and has been able to help her husband with expenses and with her children’s schooling.  María sells the clothes she knits to clothes merchants.  In her free time she caters festive events to order.

She will use the loan to buy yarn to make sweaters and gloves.  Her greatest wish is to have a stand where she can sell her knitwear.  María is first on the right.

The group is grateful to Kiva lenders for the loan granted.  Valeria appears in the inserted photo above; she was unable to attend the meeting because of health issues.

loans.use: to buy yarn.

loans.name: Nadia

texts.en: Nadia is a 22-year-old single woman living with her four older siblings. Nadia is a university student majoring in pharmacology. Although her older siblings help her in her studies, Nadia wanted to lessen the financial pressure on them for the next semester and has applied for an educational loan to pay for her upcoming semester.

loans.use: to pay for her upcoming semester at the university.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys has been operating a beauty salon business. Her potential customers are neighbors and town dwellers. She dreams of incorporating her business into a beauty training school. 

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase hair extensions, hair treatments, and shampoo. She joined Yehu because of the favorable loan requirements, and she appreciates the support given.

loans.use: to purchase hair extensions, hair treatments, and shampoo for her salon.

loans.name: Serah

texts.en:
Serah lives in the Ndaragwa area of Kenya, which has one of the cooler climates in Kenya. She has 2 children and has been doing this work for 15 years. Her primary income sources are crops.

She stated what is most enjoyable about farming: 'Nurturing the young plants.' Her biggest challenge is 'Controlling weeds.' Animals on the farm have been given no names.

Serah was asked why she chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which she replied: 'Juhudi come to us its so easy to get a loan to improve our farms.' This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session: 'Microfinace loans are changing lives.'

Her highest monthly expense is school fees. When asked 'How will this loan benefit her family', Serah replied 'We'll be able to harvest water for domestic use hence clean water for the family.'

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Serah owns the following: 'cow, poultry, pump' but does not own 'pig, bicycle, motorcycle, automobile'. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household 'solar power, TV, DVD' but does not have 'mosquito net, electricity, running water, sewing machine'.

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and send the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient, and keeping costs down.

loans.use: To purchase a water tank

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en: Mahmoud is a 26-year-old single man. During the day, he works in a barbershop, and after that he sells clothes at home with the help of his mother. Now Mahmoud is applying for a youth loan to buy a new summer collection of men’s clothes and more women’s clothes.

loans.use: to buy a new summer collection of men’s clothes and more women’s clothes for resale.

loans.name: Khadija

texts.en:
Khadija is from the town of Samburu. She is married and works as a merchant. Khadija is the owner of a store where she's been working for four years. She says that she's making headway with the business, because she's attracted a good number of customers due to the fact that she always has a very well-stocked store. She is a very enthusiastic person who wants to keep growing and investing in her business so that she can help with the household expenses and continue to improve her business over time.

Khadija is requesting a loan to invest in dairy products, bread, vegetables and other products. This way, she can continue to provide her customers with a good variety of products and also attract new customers.

loans.use: to invest in dairy products, bread, vegetables and other products.

loans.name: Shelmith

texts.en:
Shellmith lives in the Ndaragwa area of Kenya, which has one of the cooler climates in Kenya. She has 6 children and has been doing this work for 20 years.  Her primary income sources are milk, eggs and crops.

She stated what is most enjoyable about farming: 'Taking care of my dairy cows'. Her biggest challenge is 'Feeding the animals.' Animals on the farm have been given the names of 'Kanji, Varentine (all cows).'

Shellmith was asked why she chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which she replied: 'It's easy to borrow.'  This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required microfinance training session: 'They assist people to get loans with little security.'

Her highest monthly expense is school fees. When asked 'How will this loan benefit your family', Shellmith replied 'It will improve my dairy farming, leading to increased milk production.'

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Shellmith owns the following: 'cow, poultry, pump and bicycle' but does not own 'pig, motorcycle or automobile'. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household 'mosquito net, solar power, running water, TV and DVD' but does not have 'electricity or sewing machine'.

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and send the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient, and keeping costs down.

loans.use: to construct a zero grazing unit

loans.name: Suzette Joy

texts.en:
Suzette Joy of San Roque, Panaon, Misamis Occidental, is a 33-year-old woman and is married with one child.

To make a living, she manages her own motor transport services to the community, earning 5,000 PHP monthly. In 2011, she became a member of GDMPC microcredit and she gains access to the financial services of the cooperative. Recently, she borrowed an amount of 15,000 PHP to purchase two sets of tires and other accessories for her existing motorcycle vehicle.

In the future, she wants to expand her business to generate additional income for a better living.

loans.use: to purchase two sets of tires and other accessories

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is 50 years old and lives in Gango Ozamiz City. She is married with adult-age children.

Judith has a coco lumber business and earns approximately PHP 10,000 each month doing this type of business. Judith thought of opening a business of "sari-sari" (variety)store. She feels there is a high demand of this in their area. She has requested a loan to  purchase items for store, such as shampoo, toothpaste, soap and canned goods.

Judith has been a member of PMPC for ten years. In the future, Judith hopes to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventories such as shampoo, toothpaste, soap and canned goods.

loans.name: María Griselda

texts.es:
María tiene 35 años de edad, es madre soltera de cuatro hijos de 17, 16, 14 y 12 años de edad respectivamente. Desde hace 10 años, ella ha instalado una pequeña tienda de productos básicos en su casa y un molino para prestar este servicio a la población. Para comprar la mercadería para la tienda debe levantarse muy temprano, debido a que el autobús recorre una distancia de 15 kilómetros. 


El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar cemento, arena, hierro para reparar el piso de su casa y para comprar mercadería para la tienda. De esta manera, mejorara las condiciones de salubridad en que viven sus hijos ya que e piso es de tierra y además que dará una mejor imagen a sus clientes y ofrecerá mayor variedad de productos. Además, con los ingresos que reciba apoya a sus hijos de 17 y 16 años que se encuentran estudiando.
texts.en:
María is 35 years old. She is a single mother of four children who are 17, 16, 14, and 12 years old. For 10 years, she has had a small grocery store in her home and a grain mill to rent out to the public. To purchase the merchandise for her store, she must get up very early because the bus travels a distance of 15 km.

The loan that she is requesting from Kiva partner Fundacion Campo is to purchase cement, sand, and iron to repair the floor of her house, as well as to purchase merchandise for the store. In this manner, she will improve the health conditions that her children live in because the floor is made of dirt, and besides that, it will give her customers a better impression and she will offer a wider variety of products. Also, with the income that she earns, she supports her children who are 17 and 16 years old as they go about their studies.

loans.use: purchase cement, sand, and iron to repair the floor of her house and to purchase merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Rosa Imelda

texts.es:
Rosa es una mujer de 54 años, nació y creció en un pueblito de la ciudad de Loja, alcanzando estudiar la secundaria, tuvo un hijo cuando era una jovencita, atravesando por las grandes dificultades que tiene la responsabilidad de educar sola a un hijo.  Ahora su hijo es adulto e independiente lo que llena de orgullo a Rosa. Ahora esta madre luchadora y además emprendedora vive sola en la Parroquia de Río Verde de Santo Domingo, la capital de la Provincia de Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas, una ciudad que cuenta un comercio considerable  ya que se ha convertido en un puerto terrestre de intercambio comercial entre las regiones Sierra y Costa del país. Sus varios atractivos turísticos acompañados de su clima cálido son muy concurridos por turistas nacionales y extranjeros y la mayoría de sus habitantes han emprendido con alguna actividad comercial o de servicios para habitantes y turistas.
Rosa heredó el espíritu emprendedor de su madre quien le enseñó a administrar su propio negocio, el cual lo ha sostenido durante los últimos 10 años y éste ha sido su sustento y en el cual invierte al menos 12 horas en el día, pues abre las puertas apenas amanece para suplir las necesidades de amas de casa y estudiantes que empiezan su jornada antes del amanecer y cierra las puertas cuando oscurece y ya todos descansan. Rosa ha crecido con su negocio y ha visto que muchas demandas de sus clientes no son cumplidas, por lo que ella desea incrementar la variedad de productos para así satisfacer las necesidades de todos sus clientes y para ello solicita un préstamo que lo invertirá en compra de víveres, golosinas, bebidas, útiles de aseo para así mejorar la variedad de productos e incrementar sus ventas con lo que obtendrá mayores utilidades que le permitirán mejorar su calidad de vida y además tener ahorros suficientes para cubrir eventos fortuitos de salud, alimentación, etc. Rosa agradece a los inversionistas de Kiva que promueven la microempresa pero además agradece a Fundación Alternativa quienes le otorgaron confianza y agilidad para ella poder dar este paso de crecimiento.
texts.en:
Rosa is a 54-year-old woman who was born and grew up in a small village near the town of Loja.  She has a high school education but had a child when she was still very young and had to face the great difficulties that accompany the responsibility of educating a child alone.  Her son is now an adult and lives independently which fills Rosa with pride.  Now this tenacious, entrepreneurial mother lives alone in Río Verde parish in Santo Domingo, the capital of Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas province.  This city has a lot of commercial activity as it has become an important dry port where commercial exchanges are made between the mountainous and coastal regions of the country.  Its various tourist attractions, together with its warm weather, make it very popular with tourists from both at home and abroad.  Most of the locals run some kind of commercial or service-based business aimed at local people and tourists. 

Rosa inherited her entrepreneurial spirit from her mother who taught her to run her own business, which she has kept running for the last 10 years.  It is how she has earned her living and she works at least 12 hours a day in her store as she opens thr doors when the day has barely begun to supply local housewives and students who are beginning their day before dawn, and she closes the doors when it gets dark and everybody is already home relaxing.  

Rosa has grown alongside her business and has seen that her customers have a lot of demands which go unfulfilled.  For this reason, she would like to increase the variety of products she offers so that she can meet the needs of all her customers.  She is requesting a loan to invest in buying food products, candies, drinks and toiletries so that she can increase her range of products and increase her sales.  This will make her more profits which will allow her to improve her quality of life and save up enough to cover any unanticipated health and food needs in the future.  Rosa is grateful to Kiva lenders who sponsor her micro-business.  She is also thankful to Fundación Alternativa for putting their trust in her and enabling her to take this step towards growing her business.

loans.use: to buy merchandise and increase the variety of products she sells

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en:
Rosemary is 59 years old. She is married and has five children. She lives in Pta. Sulong, Baliango. Rosemary is in the fish industry, catching and selling fish. She has been in this business for 18 years and earns a monthly income of 5,600 PHP. Rosemary is a Paglaum MPC member since 2005.

Rosemary dreams of improving their living condition through renovating their house. She is requesting the loan from PMPC and hopes to pay the loan amount through the income of her business.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials needed for house repair.

loans.name: Leny
