On her own initiative and with much hard work and dedication, Gavi works as a hired hand on a farm in her city.  She carries out tasks such as planting, fertilizing, harvesting, etc.  She works an average eight hours a day, every day, and believes work is going well for her because of her kindness to others.

Gavi is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to your help she will be able to renovate her house.  She wants to cover the walls and paint them to make the home an adequate living space.  This will allow her to continue working and striving toward her goal of leading a better lifestyle.

loans.use: To renovate her house.

loans.name: Jeannette

texts.es: Jeannette, tiene la edad  de 23 años, está soltera, vive con sus padres y hermanos, los cuales son mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra de madera y materiales de construcción y pagar mano de obra en la reparación a la vivienda, y de esta manera eliminar algunas entradas de agua a la vivienda en el periodo de lluvia que ya casi inicia y así poderle ofrecer una mejor calidad de vida a su familia. Con esta compra pretende hacer una mejora de buena calidad a su casa y que su familia mejoré su calidad de vida y aprovechar precios bajos en algunos materiales y que son de buena calidad. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Jeanette is 23 years old. She is single and lives with her parents and brothers who are older. With her loan, she intends to buy wood and construction materials and to pay for the labor to repair her house and, in this way, eliminate some leaks that occur during the rainy season that is about to start and offer a better quality of life to her family. With this purchase, she intends to provide a good quality improvement to her house and her family will improve their quality of life and she will take advantage of low prices on some materials that are of good quality. This is the first loan she has received from Fudecosur. She has not had other loans previously from state banks but Fudecosur has provided a loan with greater ease and the interest rate is much lower.

loans.use: to improve her house.

loans.name: Jose

texts.es:
Jose tiene 58 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa, ciudad de clima calido y acogedor, asimismo posee atractivos turísticos hermosos y sus pobladores son personas de carácter alegre y amable. Jose vie al lado de su esposa y juntos tienen 4 hijos, los cuales ya son mayores de edad y por los cuales ha luchado de manera incansable para convertirlos en personas de bien. Debido a sus pocos recursos económicos solo pudo estudiar hasta el cuarto de primaria pero le hubiera gustado tener una carrera universitaria especialmente estudiar ingeniería agrónoma.

Día a día Jose trabaja como agricultor, actualmente ha sembrado Camu Camu, el cual es un fruto originario de la selva peruana y poseedor de muchas propiedades curativas, especialmente para la diabetes, Jose trabaja en su cultivo alrededor de 8 horas al día y con el fruto de su trabajo puede sacar adelante con mucho esfuerzo a su familia; Jose cree que está saliendo adelante porque es responsable y sobre todo porque tiene muchas ganas de progresar.

Jose está muy agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le están brindando el podrá comprar abono, fertilizantes y poder dar mantenimiento, regadío para su cultivo, así el podrá tener una buena cosecha y podrá mejorar sus ingresos  y de esta manera el podrá seguir trabajando para poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Tener más hectáreas para sembrar y mejorar su calidad de vida”.
texts.en:
Jose is 58 years old. He lives in the city of Pucallpa, a city with a warm and welcoming climate. At the same time, it has beautiful tourist attractions and its residents are people of a happy and friendly character. Jose lives with his wife and together they have four children who are adults and for whom they have fought tirelessly to ensure they become good people. Due to their small economic resources, he was only able to study up to the fourth year of primary school but he would have liked to have a university career especially to study agricultural engineering.

Day after day, Jose works as a farmer. Currently he has planted Camu Camu which is a native fruit of the Peruvian jungle and has many healing properties, especially for diabetes. Jose works in his crops for around eight hours a day and with the fruit of his labor he can get his family ahead with much effort. Jose believes that he is moving forward because he is responsible and, above all, because he has a lot of desire to progress.

Jose is very thankful to the Kiva lenders since, thanks to the help they are providing, he will be able to buy organic and chemical fertilizers and be able to provide maintenance and irrigation to his crops. So he will be able to have a good harvest and be able to improve his income and, in this way, he will be able to keep working to realize his greatest dream: "To have more hectares to sow and improve his quality of life."

loans.use: to purchase organic and chemical fertilizers, and maintenance, among other things.

loans.name: Abad

texts.es:
Abad tiene 49 años de edad, es un padre muy cariñoso y sobre todo se esfuerza mucho para poder sacar a su hija adelante, y es por ello que abad trabaja como cerrajero, y gracias a este oficio puede solventar los gastos de su hogar. Día a Día Abad le dedica a su negocio alrededor de 9 horas al día y puede atender hasta 3 clientes diariamente ya que depende del tipo de estructura y del tamaño que le piden sus clientes.

Abad está muy agradecido por el apoyo que le brindan los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá pagar la matrícula y algunas mensualidades del instituto de su hija, de esta manera Abad podrá brindarle una mejor educación a su hija y seguir luchando para poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Darle una profesión a su hija y tener un negocio más grande”.
texts.en:
Abad, 49, is a loving father who works very hard to provide for his daughter.  He works as a locksmith to earn a living to cover household expenses.  Every day Abad spends around nine hours working and tendind to an average three customers a day, depending on the type and size of structure being requested of him.

Abad is very grateful for the support he receives from Kiva lenders because thanks to you he will be able to pay for registration fees and tuition for his daughter's education.  This will allow Abad to give his daughter the best education he can while he continues working toward his goal of "Giving his daughter professional training and running a larger business".

loans.use: To pay for his daughter's registration fees and tuition.

loans.name: Giner

texts.es: Giner, tiene la edad  de 44 años, está casado pero vive solo. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra de fertilizantes, fungicidas y pagar mano de obra en trabajos de asistencia para el café, además de comprar algunas plantas de almácigo para hacer resiembras a inicio de lluvias esto con el objetivo de aumentar la densidad de plantas por área, además de aprovechar la buena fertilidad del suelo y las condiciones de clima y otras que favorecen al cultivo de café. Con estas mejoras al cultivo espera obtener un poco de ganancias y así mejorar las condiciones de vida y también invertir un poco más en el área de cultivo y también cumplir algunas metas personales.  Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Él no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Giner is 44 years old. He is married but he lives alone. With his loan, he intends to buy fertilizer, fungicide and to pay for labor costs to help with the coffee. He will also buy some seedlings to do some re-planting when the rains begin in order to increase the density of plants by area. and take advantage of the good soil fertility and weather conditions that favor coffee growing. With these improvements to the crop he hopes obtain a little profit. This will help him improve his quality of life and also invest a little more in the planting area and achieve some personal goals. This is the first loan that he has received from FUDECOSUR. He hasn't had any previous loans with state banks, but FUDECOSUR has offered him a loan with more ease of payment and a much lower rate of interest.

loans.use: to plant coffee.

loans.name: Jeison

texts.es: Jeison, tiene la edad  de 29 años, está unión libre, vive con sus hijos y esposa, los cuales son su mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra de equipos y herramientas para realizar trabajos de albañil, las cuales le facilitará la elaboración del trabajo y con mejores acabados y así poder aumentar la cantidad del trabajo y aprovechar el conocimiento adquirido en capacitaciones y poder tener ingresos económicos para seguir invirtiendo en la compra de herramientas y otras productos, y  también lograr un mejor acabado a los trabajos realizados. Con esta compra pretende aumentar la demanda y con diseños más variados y así cumplir con los contratos a corto plazo. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Jeison is 29 years old. He is in a common law marriage and lives with his children and wife. They are his main priority. With the loan, he intends to buy equipment and tools to do masonry work. This will make it easier to do his work with better finishings, thus increasing the amount of work and taking advantage of the knowledge he has acquired in trainings. This will make him able to have the income to keep investing in buying tools and other products and do better finishings on the work he has done. With this purchase, he intends to increase demand with more varied designs, finishing orders in a short time. This is his first loan with FUDECOSUR. He hasn't had any loans with state banks, but FUDECOSUR has offered him a loan with more ease of payment and a much lower rate of interest.

loans.use: to do wood preparation

loans.name: Luis

texts.es: Luis Antonio, tiene la edad  de 20 años, está soltero, vive con sus padres y hermanos, los cuales son su mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra de equipo para la preparación de madera para hacer muebles, la cual le facilitará la elaboración de madera y así poder aumentar la cantidad de muebles realizados y aprovechar el conocimiento adquirido en capacitaciones y poder tener ingresos económicos para seguir invirtiendo en la compra de madera y otras productos, y  también lograr un mejor acabado a los muebles fabricados, además de aumentar la cantidad y calidad de piezas. Con esta compra pretende hacer más nubles y con diseños más variados y así cumplir con los pedidos a corto plazo. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Luis Antonio is 20 years old. He is single and lives with his parents and brothers, who are older. With his loan, he intends to buy equipment to prepare wood to make furniture which will make the development of wood easier so he can increase the amount of furniture made and use the knowledge gained in training to have income to continue to invest in the purchase of wood and other products and also to achieve a better finish to the furniture made and expand the quantity and quality of pieces. With this purchase, he intends to make more furniture with more varied designs and fulfill the orders in the short term. This is the first loan he has received from Fudecosur. He has not had other loans from state banks before but Fudecosur has provided the loan with greater ease and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy sawmill equipment.

loans.name: Marie Grace

texts.en: Marie Grace is 36 years old. She sells sweaters and sportswear. With this loan, she would like to buy more clothes, such as sweaters, to sell. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for her three children.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en: Fatuma is 30 years old. She has sold fruits like pineapples for the past three years. With this loan, she would like to buy more pineapples to sell. The profits from the business will be used to make more savings.

loans.use: to purchase more fruits to sell.

loans.name: Gilberto Isidoro

texts.es:
Gilberto tiene 38 años de edad, vive al lado de su hijo a quien saca delante solo ya que es padre soltero, cada día Gilberto se esfuerza mucho para poder brindarle a su hijo una vida digna y mejores oportunidades. 
Día a día Gilberto trabaja como empleado en una empresa e su ciudad, con el fruto de su trabajo solventa los gastos de su hogar y es por ello que trabaja alrededor de 8 horas al día; Gilberto cree que está saliendo adelante porque es muy responsable y sobre todo porque su hijo es su mayor motivación.

Gilberto está muy agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá comprar útiles escolares para su hijo, así como también el uniforme, así Gilberto podrá brindarle a su pequeño los materiales necesarios para que estudien y seguir luchando para poder hacer realidad su mas grande sueño:” Tener su casa propia”.
texts.en:
Gilberto is 38 years old. He lives alongside his son who he is moving forward alone since he is a single father. Every day, Gilberto works hard to be able to provide his son with a dignified life and better opportunities.

Day after day, Gilberto works as an employee at a company in his city. With the fruit of his work, he pays the bills and it is for this that he works around eight hours a day. Gilberto believes that he is progressing because he is very responsible and, above all, because his son is his greatest motivation.

Gilberto is very thankful to the Kiva lenders since, thanks to the help they have provided, he will be able to buy school supplies for his son as well as the uniform. So Gilberto will be able to provide to his little one the necessary materials for him to study and keep fighting to be able to make his greatest dream a reality: "To have his own home."

loans.use: to purchase school supplies, uniforms, among other things.

loans.name: La Inmaculada Group

texts.es:
El comité ´´La Inmaculada” se formó con la unión de varias vecinas de la ciudad de Santaní. Las integrantes formaron un grupo muy unido y capaz de realizar conjuntamente actividades que fortalecen su compañerismo y tratan siempre de ayudarse las unas a las otras para salir adelante.
Zunilda una de las miembros, comenta que se dedica a la venta ambulante de productos como ser prendas, calzados, sandalias, y demás productos. Ella cuenta que ya tiene muy buena clientela gracias a que es una persona muy hábil para las ventas que desde siempre ha trabajado. Su meta es seguir creciendo para poder dar a su familia lo que necesitan.
Zunilda solicita de este crédito para invertirlo en la compra de calzados y prendas de invierno, para poder surtirse, y de esa forma seguir con sus ventas y tener un mejor ingreso para su familia.
texts.en:
The "La Inmaculada" committee formed with the union of various neighbors in the city of Santani. The members formed a very united group, capable of completing work together that strengthened their fellowship and they try always to help each other to get ahead. 

Zunilda, one of the members, comments that she is dedicated to selling on foot products like clothes, shoes, sandals and other products. She says that she already has very good customers thanks to her being a very skilled sales person who has always worked. Her goal is to keep growing to be able to give her family what they need.

Zunilda is requesting this loan to invest it in the purchase of shoes and winter clothes to be able to increase stock and, in this way, keep up with her sales and have better income for her family.

loans.use: to buy shoes and winter clothes to sell.

loans.name: Victor Jose Luis

texts.es:
Victor tiene 23 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de Imperial, la cual se caracteriza por tener un clima variado y acogedor, asimismo se desarrolla la agricultura en especial el cultivo de maíz, manzana, plátano, entre otros. Victor vive al lado de sus padres, los cuales debido a los pocos recursos económicos solo pudieron darle educación hasta el tercer grado de educación secundaria, pero a Victor le hubiera gustado estudiar la carrera de Mecánica automotriz.

Día a día Victor trabaja como jornalero en un fundo de su ciudad, trabaja alrededor de 9 horas al día y también producto de sus ahorros logro iniciar su negocio de crianza y venta de cuyes, con lo cual tiene un ingreso extra y con ello apoya a sus padres con los gastos de su hogar; Victor cree que le está saliendo adelante porque es muy responsable y sobre todo porque tiene muchas ganas de salir adelante.

Victor está muy agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá comprar jaulas especiales para la crianza de cuyes, ya que actualmente tiene varios cuyes hembras preñadas y con cesta mejora podrá criarlas en un lugar más seguro; así el podrá mejorar sus ingresos y seguir luchando cada día para poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño:”Poder estudiar la carrera de mecánica automotriz”.
texts.en:
Victor, 23, lives in the city of Imperial, known for its changing but charming climate. He works in agriculture, growing corn, apples and plantains, among other crops. Victor lives with his parents, who could only pay for his education up to the third grade of secondary school, due to the lack of money. However, he would have liked to study to be an auto mechanic.

Victor works every day as a day laborer for a farm located near his city. He works around nine hours and thanks to his savings, he managed to start a business raising and selling guinea pigs. This has given him an extra income with which he helps his parents with the home expenses. Victor believes he is getting ahead because he is responsible, but mainly because of his will to succeed.

Victor greatly appreciates the help that Kiva lenders have given him. He will be able to buy special pens for his guinea pigs. Some of them are pregnant and with these pens he will be able to provide them with a safer environment. This will also result in better income and will help him pursuit his biggest dream: To be able to study auto mechanics.

loans.use: to buy pens for his guinea pigs.

loans.name: Saúl Alberto

texts.es:
Saúl tiene 61 años de edad, es casado y tiene cuatro hijos (dos mujeres y dos hombres). Se dedica a la agricultura y a la crianza de ganado. Es pensionado, debido a que trabajo como vigilante de seguridad durante 15 años. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar madera, teja, lámina y medicinas para un tratamiento que tiene su papa. Los materiales los utilizara para reparar el techo de su vivienda, se encuentra en muy malas condiciones y ya empezó la época lluviosa y se le ha filtrado el agua, ocasionando incomodidades a su familia y enfermedades. Además, que dispondrá del dinero para adquirir los medicamentos para el tratamiento de su padre. Su deseo, es continuar trabajando en la agricultura, sembrando maíz, cuidar sus bueyes que le sirven para acarrear agua, realizarle reparaciones a su vivienda y seguir cubriendo el tratamiento a su padre.
texts.en:
Saul is 61 years old. He is married and has four children (two women and two men). He is dedicated to farming and raising cattle. He is a pensioner, since he worked as a security guard for 15 years.

The loan that he is requesting from Fundacion Campo is to buy wood, tile, laminate and medicines for a treatment his father has. The materials will be used to repair the roof of his house. It is in very bad condition and the rainy season has already started and water has leaked, causing discomfort for his family, as well as illness. Additionally, he will use the money to acquire medicines for his father's treatment. His wish is to continue working in agriculture, planting maize, caring for his oxen which serve him by carrying water, to repair his house and keep covering his father's treatment.

loans.use: to buy wood, tile, laminate and medicines for a treatment for his father.

loans.name: Kadiatu

texts.en:
This is 35-year-old Kadiatu from the Tombo Western rural area in Freetown. She is married with 2 children between the ages of 8 and 13 years. She started business because she wants to generate a permanent source of income since she did not go to school.

Kadiatu runs a stick business within her area; she sells sticks and wood. She has been running this business since 2006. She works at the business every day, morning to night.  She says that her business is doing well because with the profit she is able to take care of herself and her family. 

Kadiatu has requested a loan to buy more sticks and wood to resell. The extra income from this loan will allow her to grow her business and pay her children's school fees. In the future, she plans to open a provision store. She appreciates your support.

loans.use: to buy more sticks and wood to resell.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
This is Esther from Liberia.  She resides in Buchanan, the capital city of Grand Bassa county. The county is located by the sea and is known for its beaches and fish. In addition, many logging companies are located in the city. People in Buchanan are known in the country for their love of fufu, a cassava based dough typically eaten with soup or sauce. 

She is 28 and single, and she has a four-year-old child.  Her child is currently living at home and attending school.  

Esther has owned her own small local business selling rice, onions, oil, and other items for the past 10 years. She will use the loan proceeds to purchase more goods.  

On average, she works 9 hours at her business from Monday to Saturday. She started her business with a small amount of money from her fiancee. She transports her merchandise by shared taxi. She cites the rainy season as her biggest challenge. Her favorite part of her business is making profits. In the future, she would like to build a modern shop.  

She is grateful for your support!

loans.use: to purchase more goods to sell.

loans.name: Claire

texts.en: Claire is 27 years old. She has sold sodas and beers for the past four years. With this loan, she would like to buy more sodas and beers to sell. With the profits from this loan, she will reinvest in her business.

loans.use: to buy more beers and sodas for sale.

loans.name: Mariatu

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 35-year-old Mariatu from Tombo, in the Western Rural District near Freetown. She is married with 2 children aged 1 years and 8 years. Both of her children attend school. 

Mariatu runs a fish business; she sells fish. She has been running this business since 2004. She works at the business 10 hours per day and 7 days per week. She says that despite the business hardship, she very hardworking and wants to become successful.

Mariatu has requested a loan in order to buy more dry fish to resell. The extra income from this loan will allow her to grow her business and pay her installments. In the future, she plans to expand her business to a higher level. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to buy more dry fish to resell.

loans.name: Nathan

texts.en:
Nathan lives in the Litein area of Kenya, which houses a campus of Mt. Kenya University. He has 6 children and has been doing this work for 6 years. His primary income sources are milk, eggs, and tea.

He says that doing farming activities is the most enjoyable thing about farming. His biggest challenge is inadequate funds. The animals on his farm have not been given names.

Nathan was asked why he chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, and he cited the organization's good loan terms. When asked what he  learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session, Nathan said "It offers training to farmers.'

His highest monthly expense is school fees. He said that this loan would improve his family's living standards.

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Nathan owns the following: a cow, and poultry, but he does not own a pig, a pump, a bicycle, a motorcycle, or an automobile. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has a mosquito net in his household, but does not have electricity, solar power, running water, a sewing machine, a TV, or a DVD player. 

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and send the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient, and keeping costs down."

loans.use: to purchase poultry.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is 40 years old and married with 5 children between 2 and 19 years old. She runs a fish business in in Tombo, which is in the Western Rural District in Sierra Leone.

To earn a living, she’s been in this business since 1998; she sells fish at home. Her husband is out of a job, so she has to run a business to have a permanent source of income. She says that the main challenges to her business are her business's location and financing to run her business at present. She is struggling to survive   .

Esther requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to buy more fish to resell. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her move from  a single room to a big residential apartment. In the future, she would like to open a local food store and build a big house. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to buy more fish to resell.

loans.name: Karina

texts.es:
Karina, de 33 años de edad, está casada y tiene un hijo pequeño con quien vive en su casa propia. La actividad que realiza Karina es la venta de diversos alimentos procesados ya sea chicha de jora, chica de maíz, frijol cocinado, fariña, jugo de caña y otros productos que prepara con sus propias manos.Su puesto de venta está ubicado en un mercado cercano a su vivienda , en ocasiones sus ventas son muy buenas ya que logra vender todo lo que ofrece durante el día , además trabaja con la ayuda de su hermana. Realiza esta actividad desde hace 12 años brindando siempre una buena atención a sus clientes. Considera a su negocio bastante rentable ya que le genera buenas ganancias económicas. Por otro lado nos comenta que decidió iniciar esta labor pensando en el bienestar de su familia y apoyar a su esposo con los gastos de su hogar.  Ahora espera establecer otro puesto de venta e incrementar sus ingresos económicos.En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 800, por tanto agradece la oportunidad que le brindan para acceder al crédito que necesita para continuar con el logro de sus metas.
Con el monto solicitado comprará yuca y maiz al por mayor para que prepare los productos que pone a la venta.
texts.en:
Karina is 33 years old, married, and has a young son who lives with her in a home of her own.  Karina sells different types of prepared  foods, such as chicha, cooked beans, casava, sugar cane juice, and other things she prepares with her own hands.  She sells at a market near her home and at times her sales are good and she sells out during the day.  Her sister also helps her.  She's been doing this for 12 years and has always provided good service to her customers.  She considers her business to be profitable because it generates good financial earnings.  She also says that she decided to start this business, thinking about her family's wellbeing, and to help her husband with the household expenses.  Now she is hoping to set up another stall and increase her income.  This time she is asking f or a loan of S/. 800 and is grateful for the opportunity she has to het this loan, which she needs to complete her goals.

She will use the money to buy yucca and corn in quantity, so she can prepare the products she sells.

loans.use: to buy ingredients.

loans.name: Kadiatu

texts.en:
This is 40-year-old Kadiatu from Tombo Western rural area in Freetown. She is married with four children between the ages of six years and 22. For the past nine years, she has run a soft-drink business selling soda and purified water.  Kadiatu works every day, moving within her environment to sell her wares. She says that her business is doing well and that she is able to take care of her children with her profits. 

Kadiatu is requesting a loan to buy a variety of drinks and pure water. She will use the extra income from her loan to expand her business and educate her children. In the future, Kadiatu plans to become a palm oil and gari seller. She appreciates your support.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks drinks and pure water

loans.name: Gbassay

texts.en:
This is 20-year-old Gbassay from Tombo Western rural area in Freetown. She is single with a three-year-old child. She did not attend school. For the past three years, Gbassay has been running a ginger juice and bread business. She works every day, moving through her environment to sell her wares. Gbassay says that her business is doing well and she is able to take care of her child with her profits.

Gbassay is requesting a loan to buy more ginger juice and bread. She will use the extra income from her loan to expand her business and enter an adult education school. Gbassay plans to become a hairdresser in the future. She appreciates your support.

loans.use: to buy ginger juice and bread

loans.name: Aminata

texts.en:
Meet Aminata. She is in her early 40s and is from Tombo Western rural area in Freetown. Aminata is married with four children between the ages of seven and 15. Three of her children currently attend school. Aminata established a fruit-selling business 15 years ago. She began her business because she needed an income to support her home. Aminata works 10 hours a day, six days a week. Her major business challenge is her poor location. 

Aminata is requesting a loan to buy more fruit such as mango, banana, and apple to sell. She hopes that the extra income from her loan will allow her to expand her business and have a permanent business structure. In the future, Aminata plans to own her own permanent residence. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy fruit such as mango, banana, and apple

loans.name: Rugiatu

texts.en:
This is 30-year-old Rugiatu from Tombo Western rural area in Sierra Leone. She is widowed with three children. For the past three years, Rugiatu has run a business selling soft drinks, juice, and purified water.  She started this business to have an income for her daily food. Rugiatu works 10 hours a day, six days a week.  Her major business challenges are poor electric supply and insufficient funds. 

Rugiatu is requesting a loan to buy more soft drinks, juice, and pure water. She will use the extra income from her loan to purchase new products such as palm oil and gari to sell. In the future, Rugiatu plans to buy a generator to light her house. She appreciates your support.

loans.use: to buy more soft drinks, juice, and pure water

loans.name: Shamim

texts.en: Ms Shamim is 45 years old married woman. For the past 20 years, she has been successfully running a business of milk sales in her community. She has become famous in her area for providing good quality milk. She counts a good client list and makes enough to contribute to her family's income. She is loving mother of five children. Her husband is a labor whose income is not sufficient to meet the household expenses alone. Therefore, Shamim is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, health and education. Currently she requested loan of Rs.30,000 to purchase another buffalo. She expects boost in her earnings with her loan and plans to spend the part of profits on the expansion of her business.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo.

loans.name: Perveen

texts.en: Ms Perveen is a 38-years-old married woman and a mother of four.  She has been running small general for a period of about two years. She offers a variety of grocery items at a reasonable price and has retained many customers who regularly shop at her store.  She makes enough to provide for her family. To make her store fully stocked she requested a loan for Rs.  30,000 which she will use to buy rice, sugar and flour from the market at lower rates. In this way she would be able to meet the increasing demand consistently.  She wishes to utilize part of her revenues to increase her business capital.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar and flour from the market at lower rates.

loans.name: Muqadas

texts.en: Ms Muqadas is 43 years old, married woman. She has five children, two daughters and three sons. She is striving hard to meet their demands including food, clothing, and health. Her husband is employed in a small restaurant but his income is not sufficient to meet the daily expenditures of the family. She started her business of sewing clothes to contribute in the family income. She is well familiar with the stitching techniques and has attained regular list of customers. To meet the orders of her customers on time she contacted Kashf Foundation and requested a loan of Rs. 20,000/- to buy spools of threads along with the packs of laces, zippers and needles.  So then she would be able to meet the demands of her customers without fail.  She hopes to grow her business and dreams of giving a good and quality education to her children through all her hard work in her business.

loans.use: to buy spools of threads along with the packs of laces, zippers and needles.

loans.name: Abida

texts.en: Ms Abida is 43 year old vigorous lady and a mother of six children; she has been stitching clothes for many years. She stitches for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family. However, due to lack of availability of funds she is unable to meet with the daily demands of her customers. For this reason she requested a loan of Rs 35,000 to Kashf Foundation. She intends to use this loan amount to buy more spools of threads in different colors with the packs of laces, zippers and buttons to create a means of increasing revenues so she may able to generate healthier source of income. She is in her 4th loan cycle and thankful to Kashf for its tremendous support.

loans.use: to buy more spools of threads in different colors with the packs of laces, zippers and buttons.

loans.name: Nadia

texts.en: Ms Nadia is 27 years old lady; she is a hardworking woman who is helping her family by providing services of tailoring in her community. She is doing it for the past three years. She very well knows the techniques of stitching. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns enough to lead a decent life. To help her continue operations of her business, she requested for a loan of Rs.15000/- to buy a stock of threads along with the packs of  zippers and buttons in different colors to meet up with the increasing demand. In addition to repaying the loan, she will use part of the revenues to deal with personal expenses.

loans.use: to buy a stock of threads along with the packs of  zippers and buttons in different colors.

loans.name: Kaneez

texts.en: Ms Kaneez is a 43 year old married woman. She has had a business selling vegetables for the past fifteen years. By time she has become famous for providing fresh vegetables in her community. She is very enthusiastic in her business and manages to earn a reasonable amount of money to support her family. Kaneez is a loving mother of two children and is responsible for their food, health and education. She is trying hard to fulfill their basic necessities through her business. For the improvement of her business, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of Rs. 35,000 to purchase stocks of potatoes, onions and gingers to inflate her sales.  She is in her 4th loan cycle with good repayment history. She dreams of providing quality education to her children towards their prosperous future.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of potatoes, onions and gingers to inflate her sales.

loans.name: Kadiatu

texts.en:
Kadiatu is 25 years old and married with two children, ages six and 10. For the past two years, she has been running a business selling rubber and plastic buckets and bowels in Tombo Western rural area in Sierra Leone. Kadiatu started her business to earn a daily living. Her  major business challenge is that sometimes her bowels break during transport. 

Kadiatu is requesting a loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase more buckets, big bowls, and cups to sell. She will use the extra income from her loan to expand her business and pay her children's school fees. In the future, Kadiatu would like to open a big shop. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to purchase buckets, big bowls, and cups to sell

loans.name: Maria Jesus

texts.es:
Maria es una mujer de 31 años, es soltera, vive en la ciudad de Camaná, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; gracias a su deseo por salir adelante, Maria pudo estudiar la carrea técnica de agronomía, en sus ratos libres le gusta salir a pescar con sus amigas y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Arroz Chaufa para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Maria trabaja como obrera de campo en un fundo agrícola de su ciudad, ella realiza labores de sembrado, abono, cosecha y otros, Maria trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 8 horas y cree que le va bien por su buen desempeño y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Maria se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar el mejoramiento de su vivienda, ya que desea pintar y ponerle piso de concreto a su hogar, de esta manera Maria tendrá un lugar adecuado para vivir, así pues ella seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de tener un buen trabaja que le ayude a mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Maria is a 31 year old woman. She is single. She lives in the city of Camaná. She is a very friendly, hardworking and enthusiastic person, who is determined to do well in life. Thanks to this determination, Maria was able to study agronomy at third level. In her free time, she likes to go out fishing with her friends and sometimes she cooks a delicious Arroz Chaufa (Chinese Peruvian fried rice dish) to share with her family.

On her own initiative, and through hard work and dedication, Maria found a job working in the fields on a farm in her city. She carries out tasks such as sowing, spreading fertiliser and harvesting etc. Maria works every day for approximately 8 hours. She believes that it is going well for her because she works hard and gets on well with other people.

Maria is very grateful to the Kiva lenders, as thanks to their help, she can make improvements to her home. She wants to paint it and lay a concrete floor. In this way Maria will have a decent place to live, and she can continue to work and work towards achieving her dream of obtaining a good job which will enable her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to make improvements to her house

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en: Ms Naseem is a 43-year-old married woman. She is in the business of manufacturing artificial jewelry; she beautifully makes bracelets and necklaces in various colors and then sells them to the people of her community and makes enough to contribute in the family income. She has six children; all is school going. In order to meet the orders of her customers on time and boost her sales, Naseem requested a loan of Rs.35, 000 to purchase raw material such as silver, gold and dozens of artificial gems and pearls. She hopes to get increase in her earnings and wishes to spend the part of profits on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to purchase raw material such as silver, gold and dozens of artificial gems and pearls.

loans.name: Aneela

texts.en: Ms Aneela is a 41 year old married woman and a mother of four. She is been in business of beauty parlor since eight years. She offers many facilities to her customers such as makeup, hair styling and facials. Through her best providing services she has become very famous in her street. In order to meet with the increasing demands of her customers, she is interested in buying more variety of cosmetics products for the parlor.  But because of having low cash in hand she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied a loam of Rs. 40,000 to buy hair care products, skin products and creams of bleaching and whitening in large quantities. She is in her 6th loan cycle and has shown excellent repayment behavior. She is hopeful to cater to more customers time after time. She dreams to expand her business in the near future.

loans.use: to buy hair care products, skin products and creams of bleaching and whitening in large quantities.

loans.name: Kousar

texts.en: Ms Kousar is a 33-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store with her husband at the corner of her house. The man shown in the photo is Kousar’s husband. They have gain three years of experience in this field.  Her husband assists her by purchasing stock of goods from the market and dealing with customers by sitting at the shop. She is a mother of three children and is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing and health. She wants to grow her business so she requested a loan of Rs. 40,000 to buy packs of various items such as grains, soaps with some spools of threads to meet with the increasing demand at her store. She is expecting boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy packs of various items such as grains, soaps with some spools of threads.

loans.name: Samina

texts.en: Ms Samina is 45 years old, married woman and a mother of four children. She is striving hard to meet their demands, including food, clothing, and health. Her husband is employed with low salary income that is why Samina started her own business of sewing clothes to contribute in the family income. She is well familiar with the stitching techniques. She initiated her business with the support of Kashf foundation; she took her first loan to buy a sewing machine. At present, she enjoys a great client list and has gained a lot of appreciation and popularity in her community. Currently she requested a loan of Rs 30,000 to buy a stock of threads in different colors with the packs of needles and buttons. So then she would be able to meet the demands of her customers. She dreams to provide better standard of living to her children through all her hard work in her business.

loans.use: to buy a stock of threads in different colors with the packs of needles and buttons.

loans.name: Rozatta

texts.en:
Please meet 52-year-old Rozatta from St. Paul in Liberia. St. Paul is home to the oldest market in Liberia and is known for its fish due to its location by the sea. St. Paul is a suburb located just outside Monrovia, past Freeport.  It is one of the poorer areas and you will often find its residents living in sub-standard housing. Rozatta is married with two children ages 25 and 28. She completed school through grade 12 and her husband is a security officer. Rozatta owns her own shop where she has been selling cement for the past 25 years.  On average, she works eight hours a day. Rozatta started her business with money from her husband and she transports her merchandise by bus. Her major business challenge is the rainy season, and her favorite aspect of her business is the flow of customers.

Rozatta is requesting a loan to purchase cement. In the future, she would like to build a house. Rozatta thanks you in advance for your support!

loans.use: to purchase cement

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Please meet 42-year-old Esther from St. Paul in Liberia. St. Paul is home to the oldest market in Liberia and is known for its fish due to its location by the sea. St. Paul is a suburb located just outside Monrovia, past Freeport.  It is one of the poorer areas and you will often find its residents living in sub-standard housing. Esther is married with five children between the ages of eight and 24. Two of her children are in school and they all live at home. Esther did not attend school. 

Esther  owns her own shop where she sells alcoholic drinks, soap, fresh milk, mayonnaise, butter, and other products. She has had her business for four years. On average, Esther works 13 hours a day and she started her business with money from her husband. Her major business challenge is the rainy season and her favorite aspect of her business is the flow of customers.

Esther is requesting a loan to purchase inventory for her store. In the future, she would like to build a house. Esther thanks you in advance for your support!

loans.use: to purchase inventory for her store

loans.name: Adama

texts.en:
Meet 35-year-old Adama from Tombo Western rural area in Freetown. She is married with four children between the ages of seven and 15. Adama's children are currently attending school. In 2010, Adama established a clothing business. She began her business because she needed to create an income to support her home. Adama works 10 hours a day seven days a week. Her major business challenge is the lack of capital. 

Adama is requesting a loan to more wax cotton (batik). She hopes that the extra income from her loan will allow her to expand her business. In the future, she plans to own a big shop. Adama thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy wax cotton material

loans.name: Mariatu

texts.en:
This is Mariatu. She is in her late 20s and is single with three children between the ages of two and eight. She lives in Tombo, western rural Freetown. For the past two years, Mariatu has run a business selling wax cotton material (batik). She works every day from morning to night. Mariatu's major business challenge is price inflation.

Mariatu is requesting a loan to purchase a variety of wax cotton material. She will use the extra income from her loan to expand her business and have a permanent location. In the future, she plans to open a big clothing shop. Mariatu appreciates your support.

loans.use: to purchase wax cotton material

loans.name: Claudia

texts.en:
This loan will help Claudia expand her daycare center to continue providing quality care to her community in Doral, FL. 

Claudia loves working with children. “You can never stop learning from children and it is essential to provide professional care to help guide them in the right path,” Claudia says. Originally from Colombia, Claudia began her own home-based daycare center over two years ago out of the desire to create a safe and fun learning environment for children. She now has five employees and is looking to improve the quality of her daycare center. 

Claudia needs a loan to purchase new furniture, office equipment, uniforms, and materials for her space. She hopes to one day be able to contribute to her community on a larger scale by providing sports and arts programs to children of all ages in her Doral community.

loans.use: to purchase new furniture, office equipment, uniforms, and materials.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a buffet and a "churrasqueria," a traditional Brazilian style BBQ pit.

loans.name: Lorenzo

texts.en:
This loan will help Lorenzo purchase new cleaning equipment in order to expand his home-based cleaning services business. 

In 2009, Lorenzo began his own business, New Experience, a company that specializes in post-construction cleaning, pressure washing and carpet cleaning for local residences, condos and townhouses in his Pompano Beach community. 

Lorenzo is now looking to expand his business to serve more clients. This loan will allow Lorenzo to purchase a new heav- duty carpet cleaner and a tile and grout cleaner in order to accept larger contracts.

loans.use: to purchase a new carpet cleaner and a tile and grout cleaner.

loans.name: Dios Nos Ayudara Group

texts.en:
The Trust Bank "Dios Nos Ayudara" (God Will Help Us) is located in Northwestern Guatemala in Quiche. There are seven women in the group whose average age is 41 years. As each of the women has a large family, they each need to have their own businesses to contribute earnings to meet the needs of their families. Their goal is to provide the very best for their children so that they can enjoy a better life. The women realize that education is a vital key to the future of themselves and their children. 

The current president and one of the youngest members of the Trust Bank is Aracely de los Angeles Petrona. She is the 28-year-old mother of three boys. Her priority is to give her boys a healthy diet and a good education. Aracely is in her final year of high school and wants to continue her education in accounting. She can see how this course of study will greatly benefit her in her business. 

Aracely is in the textile business. She sews, weaves and sells typical skirts called "cortes," which are large tubes of colorful, woven material that are wrapped around the wearer and then secured with a belt called a "faja." She began the business eight years ago. Her business grew and Aracely applied for her first loan with Friendship Bridge approximately three years ago. She currently employs three local people who help her meet the requests of her clients. Her employees are excited to have a job as unemployment is quite high in Guatemala. Aracely is requesting a new loan which she will use to purchase a foot loom. The expansion of Aracely's business will not only benefit her own family but also three other families as well!

In her own words, "I very much appreciate the opportunity to get a loan and grow my business. Currently, I deliver thirty dozen skirts each week to wholesalers. With the additional third employee who I have just hired, I can produce more skirts. Also, with the additional income, I can keep my own children in school (kindergarten and 2nd grade) and support my own education that I will complete this year."

On behalf of her fellow members of the Trust Bank "Dios Nos Ayudara," Aracely thanks each Kiva investor who believes that a micro-loan and education can have such a far reaching impact, not only in Guatemala but throughout the world. With their businesses expanding, the women are able to see a brighter future for themselves, their families and their communities.

loans.use: to purchase a foot loom.

location.town: Santa Cruz del Quiche, El Quiche

loans.name: Giovanna

texts.en:
This loan will help Giovanna build a website to attract more clients.

Giovanna has always been interested in the pharmaceutical industry and has taken a special interest in the prevention of skin cancer. Born in Peru, Giovanna began her career in her early 20s, researching products to help prevent skin cancer. She developed her own line of skincare products and in 2006, won an award in France for the best foreign brand introduced in the French market. However, despite the award and her professional success, she was investing too much money to continue operating in Peru. 

In 2010, Giovanna moved with her family to Miami, FL, where she opened her own business, C&C Skincare. Wanting to attract more clients, Giovanna now needs capital to help market her product. This loan will help Giovanna build a website in order to advertise and promote her line of skincare products.

loans.use: to develop a web page for her company.

loans.name: Belen

texts.en: Belen of Salimpuno, Pana-on, Misamis Occidental, is a 51-year-old woman earning 6,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) a month from her garden. For two years, she has owned and managed a garden, planting and harvesting vegetables for sale. After joining GDMPC micro credit, she gained access to micro-finance services, and she is now requesting an amount of 8,000 PHP to purchase a variety of seedlings and fertilizer. She plans to expand her garden to multiply her income to have better living conditions in the future.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of seedlings and fertilizer.

loans.name: Ikaro

texts.en:
This loan will help Ikaro to purchase supplies in order to expand his restaurant and to buy advertising to reach out to more customers.

Originally from Brazil, Ikaro always dreamed of opening his own business. Even after he moved to the United States 11 years ago, this dream never died. After visiting a Brazilian restaurant in New Jersey, Ikaro returned to his home in Weymouth, MA, inspired to open a similar restaurant in Somerville, MA. 

In August 2012, Ikaro opened up Big Bite BBQ, a restaurant specializing in pork ribs, charcoal chicken, and traditional Brazilian-style side dishes. Ikaro also offers delivery and take-out service and has already gained loyal clientele. 

Now looking to expand his restaurant, Ikaro needs capital to buy more supplies in bulk and to purchase advertising to reach out to more clients. Ikaro hopes to soon open a second location in downtown Boston.

loans.use: to purchase food supplies in bulk and to buy advertising space and marketing materials.

loans.name: Ruby

texts.en:
Ruby is a 40-year-old married woman who lives in Cagay-anon, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. For four years, she has owned and operated a motor transport service in her local community, earning 5,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) a month for a living. 

In 2011, she joined GDMPC micro credit and she gained access to micro-finance services. She is now requesting a loan of 8,000 PHP to purchase motor accessories and pay for maintenance. She plans to improve the service that she offers to add customers who could give more income to her business.

loans.use: to purchase motor accessories and pay for maintenance.

loans.name: Martin

texts.en:
Martin is from El Salvador. From 2001 to 2012 he was a sales representative for a coffee distribution company in the DC metropolitan region. In 2012, the company was bought by a food distribution company and Martin was laid off. He received a compensation package that he invested in a van and coffee inventory to start his own business, doing what he knew best, selling coffee.

Since 2011 when Martin knew that the company he worked for was going to be sold, he was getting ready to transition from full employment to business owner. He incorporated his business –Palmoro- and started right away distributing a coffee brand that he knew very well from his previous job.

Martin is applying for a $5,000 loan to buy inventory to grow his business.

loans.use: to buy inventory to grow his business.

loans.name: Moheb

texts.en:
Moheb is a 36-year-old married man from Nablus city. He is a father with two sons and two daughters. Moheb works as an employee in the public sector with a low wage. Also, he owns a small medical lab center. He goes to the lab center after his work; this will insure enough income for the family. 

Moheb took a loan from FATEN. This loan will help Moheb to buy a new machine for his medical lab center. By buying this machine, the lab will be improved and encourage more customers to come.

Moheb appears in the photo while he was working in his lab.

loans.use: to buy a new machine for his medical lab center.

loans.name: Relwinde Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Relwinde fait partie de la coopérative Coopasm et est située à Doba, un petit village au sud-ouest de la Côte d’Ivoire dans la région de San Pedro. Le groupe est composé de six personnes. 
Martin Soamba a 42 ans. Il est marié et s’occupe de cinq personnes dans son foyer. Cela fait 17 ans qu’il travaille dans le cacao et il a 3 hectares de cacao certifiés Rain Forest Alliance, ce qui veut dire qu’il respecte les principes et les normes de l’agriculture durable. 

Grace au crédit, il va pouvoir acheter de l’engrais et des produits phytosanitaires pour sa plantation. Ces produits vont lui permettre d’augmenter sa production et ainsi d’accroître ses revenus. 

Avec l’argent supplémentaire, il va pouvoir scolariser ses enfants.
texts.en:
The Relwinde Group is part of the Coopasm cooperative. The group is from Doba, a small village in the southwest of Côte d'Ivoire, located in the San Pedro region. This group has six members.

Martin Soamba is 42 years of age. He is married, and is responsible for five people at home. For the past 17 years he has worked with cacao, and has three hectares of cacao farmland which are certified by the Rainforest Alliance. This means that he adheres to the principles and regulations of sustainable agriculture.

With this loan, he will be able to buy fertilizers and pesticides for his cacao plantation. These items will allow him to increase production, as well as increasing his income. With the additional money he receives, he plans to pay for his children's education.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides

The group Lucienkro 2 is part of the UCO cooperative union. The group is from Lucienkro, a small village of western Ivory Coast located in the Duékoué region. This group has eleven members.

Pierre, age 57, is a member of Lucienkro 2. He is responsible for fifteen people at home. He has been growing cacao for 24 years, and he currently has 6 hectares of cacao farmland.

With this loan, he will be able to buy fertilizers and pesticides for his cacao plantation. These items will allow him to increase production and to bolster his income. 

He plans to use the additional revenue to launch a pig farm.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides.

loans.name: Adriana

texts.en:
Adriana is applying for a loan of $1,500 from TRM (Tuba Rai Metin). She is 40 years old. She is running a kiosk in front of her house, and she will use the loan to buy stock to keep in her store such as hard drinks (beer), soft drinks (Coca-Cola, Fanta, Sprite, Sagiko), noodles, eggs, cigarettes, coffee, sugar and slippers. She is making good money from selling, and she wants to apply for a bigger loan in the future. 

Adriana is living in a town nearby the school; her kiosk is located in a strategic place where many people come to buy, including students.

loans.use: To buy hard drinks (beer), soft drinks (Coca-Cola, Fanta, Sprite, Sagiko), noodles, eggs, cigarettes, coffee, sugar and slippers.

loans.name: Dona

texts.en:
Dona, of Mialem, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental, is a 45-year-old married woman with three children. For a living, she manages her own piggery, raising piglets for sale. She has been in this business for five years, earning 10,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) a month for a living. 

After joining GDMPC last year, she gained access to microfinance and is now requesting a loan of 17,500 PHP to purchase feeds, medicine and vitamins for the livestock. She plans to renovate the pigs' shelter and to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: To purchase feeds, medicine and vitamins for the livestock.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en: Jocelyn is a 45-year-old married woman with four children lives in Mitugas, Tudela, Misamis Occidental. To make a living, she has owned and operated a motor transport business in her local community for five years. She earns 4,000 PHP monthly. In 2011, she became a member of GDMPC and she gained access to microfinance. She is now requesting an amount of 5,000 PHP to finance the maintenance costs of the motorcycle used in her business. She hopes to support her children and give them a better future.

loans.use: to finance the maintenance costs of her motorcycle

loans.name: Yealie

texts.en:
Yealie is in her late 30s and married with three children between 10 and 20 years old. Two are in school. 

She runs a cotton business in Tombo, a western rural area in Sierra Leone. She started this business to have her daily bread. She has been in this business since 2010 and sells cotton within her environment. She says that the main challenge to her business is insufficient capital to run a business.

She requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase more cotton for resale. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her improve her business and educate her children. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more cotton for resale.

loans.name: Selmith

texts.es: Selmith, de 61 años de edad, es una mujer luchadora, trabajadora y muy alegre.  Es viuda y vive en su casa propia en compañía de sus tres hijos y sus pequeños nietos.El trabajo de Selmith consiste en el alquiler de mototaxi. Tiene un vehículo que pudo obtener gracias a sus ahorros , por eso ahora tiene un chofer experimentado que diariamente acude a su casa para recibir el vehículo con el que trabaja conduciendo por las calles de la ciudad. Lleva en esta actividad cerca de 3 años y le va muy bien por que tiene un ingreso fijo el cual le ayuda a sobrellevar los gastos básicos de su hogar. Complementa esta actividad con la venta de prendas de vestir usadas.Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que puede organizar su tiempo y disponer de sus ratos libres como ella lo considere, afirma que de esta forma cumple su rol de madre de manera óptima ya que se siente una mujer capaz e independiente.Su gran deseo es establecer un negocio formal y de mayor productividad en su propia casa orientada al sector alimenticio.En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 2300 y está muy contenta por el apoyo financiero que le brindan para que pueda seguir adelante con su trabajo además se compromete a cumplir con el pago puntual de  todas sus cuotas.Con el monto solicitado renovará el tapizado y el toldo de su mototaxi.
texts.en: Selmith is 61 years old and is a hard-working, battling, very happy woman.  She is a widow and lives in her own home along with her three children and her small grandchildren.  Selmith's work consists of renting a motorcycle taxi.  She has a vehicle that she was able to obtain thanks to her savings, and now she has an experienced driver who comes to her home daily to pick up the vehicle with which he works, driving through the streets of the city.  She has been working in this area for three years and it is going well for her because it provides a fixed income which helps her to take care of household expenses.  She complements this work with the sale of used clothing.  What she likes about her work is that she can organize her time and make use of her free time as she likes.  She affirms that in this way she can accomplish her role as mother in an optimal manner since she feels that she is a capable and independent woman.  Her great dream is to establish a formal business with more productivity in her own home oriented towards the food sector.  At this time she is asking for a loan of 2300 Soles (Peruvian currency).  She is very happy with the financial help that Kiva has given in order to be able to move forward with her work.  She also promises to meet the repayment quotas punctually.  With the requested loan she will renovate the awning and upholstery of her motorcycle taxi.

loans.use: To renovate the awning and upholstery of her motorcycle taxi.

loans.name: Isha

texts.en:
Isha is 28 years old and married. She has three children between 3 and 9 years old. 

She runs a fish business in the Tombo Western rural area of Sierra Leone. She started this business to get her daily living.

She's been in this business since 2008 and sells fish within her community. She says that the main problem in her business is that to smoke the fish sometimes gives her blood pressure.

Isha requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to buy more fish for resale. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her increase her business and pay her children's school fees. In the future, she would like to buy a plot of land. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to buy more fish to resell.

loans.name: Oyunbileg

texts.en:
Mrs. Oyunbileg, 44 years old, lives with her husband and son in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. The family resides in their own house on a plot of land. She and her husband have been selling socks at the market since 2000, and in 2006, they began selling leather gloves and eyeglasses. During wintertime, sales of leather gloves increase, while in warm periods, sales of eyeglasses increase. Her husband also builds houses on contract with individuals or entities. Her elder son studies at university in India, and her younger son goes to high school in Mongolia. 

The house they live in has been deteriorated over the years and needs some repair, so she is requesting a loan of 3,700,000 MNT (Mongolian tugriks) to purchase building and insulation materials such as bricks, cement, planks, fiberglass and foam. Using those materials, her husband can repair and insulate their house. As a result, the renovated house will enable the family to burn less coal, emit less smoke and then contribute to the efforts against air pollution. The borrower is a hardworking individual who is eager to improve her family's living standard.

loans.use: to purchase building and insulation materials.

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en:
Meet Fatmata. She is in her late 30s and lives in the Tombo western rural area in Sierra Leone. She is married and has four children between the ages of 7 years and 20 years. Her children are currently attending school. 

In 2000, Fatmata established her general stock business. She began her business because she needs to get income for her daily life. She works at the business 10 hours per day and seven days per week. She says that the main challenges to her business are price inflation and lack of finance to run her business.

Fatmata requires a loan in order to buy creams and vaccines. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children and increase her business. In the future, Fatmata plans to change her business to a general merchandise shop. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy creams and vaccines.

loans.name: Lourdesita

texts.en: Lourdesita of Macabayao, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental, is a 61-year-old widow with three children. For years, she's been purchasing coco shells and producing charcoal for sale in the market. Last year, after joining GDMPC, she gained access to microfinance services, and she is now requesting an amount of 21,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) to purchase additional coco shells to produce more charcoal for sale. She hopes to expand her business to have multiplied income to be used in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional coco shells to produce more charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Basnere Group

For the past five years he has worked with cacao, and has 14 hectares of cacao farmland which are certified by the Rainforest Alliance. This means that he adheres to the principles and regulations of sustainable agriculture.

With this loan, he will be able to buy fertilizers and pesticides for his cacao plantation. These items will allow him to increase production, as well as increasing his income. 

With the additional money he receives, he plans to buy a motorcycle to get around more easily on the small dirt roads in the cacao fields.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides

loans.name: Miguel Jr.

texts.en:
Miguel Jr., aged 44, is married with four children. He is from Dalingap, Tudela, where his banana and root-crop production business is located. Miguel Jr. was only 33 years old when he started cultivating this land. That is quite a long time, but he never ceases because his passion for farming urges him to go on working. 

Each month, Miguel Jr. earns 4,000 PHP (Philippines pesos), which he uses for his family. He is now requesting an amount of 8,000 PHP from GDMPC microcredit to purchase fertilizer such as manure. He hopes that his farm will give him an abundant harvest next season.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure.

loans.name: Romeo

texts.en:
Romeo, 24, is married with one child and lives in Tudela, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. He manages a gardening business planting and harvesting bananas and root crops to earn a living. Recently, Romeo is requesting a loan of 12,000 PHP  to purchase fertilizer and finance weeding maintenance labor costs for the farm.

In the future, Romeo hopes to support his child's studies.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and finance weeding maintenance.

loans.name: Lynie

texts.en:
This member in good standing is from Disud, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte. She is Lynie and is 53 years old, married and blessed with five children.

To earn a living, Lynie has a business making and selling snacks in an elementary school. She earns about 10,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) each month doing this type of work. Lynie has requested a loan to have an additional capital for her business to buy ingredients for snack selling.

Lynie has been a member of PMPC for four years. In the future, Lynie would like to own a store in her place.

loans.use: to buy bananas, flour, sugar, etc.

location.town: Sindangan - Disud, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Tomas

texts.en:
Tomas is a farmer living in Mitugas, Tudela, Misamis Occidental. He has been farming his plantation for the past 20 years and uses his income to support the needs of his five children. Tomas earns an income of 4,000 PHP a month from this business. For this 40-year-old father, there is nothing that makes him happier than to see his children attain success in their studies. 

Tomas is requesting a loan in the amount of PhP 5,000 from GDMPC. He is new to GDMPC. He will use his loan funds to purchase seeds, seedlings, and young crops to raise.

In the future, Tomas is hopeful that he will be able to improve his business.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, seedlings, and young crops to raise

loans.name: Tania

texts.es: Tania, de 42 años, está casada y tiene 2 hijos. Vive en su casa propia junto a toda su familia y lo que más desea es poder trabajar para así generar los recursos que le permitan disfrutar con su futuro sobrellevando una vejez tranquila.Tania se dedica a la confección . Diseña, crea y refacciona diferentes prendas de vestir como blusas, pantalones o camisas de acuerdo al gusto de su cliente. Aprendió a ejercer esta actividad desde muy joven porque ayudaba a su prima en su negocio. Gracias a ese tiempo invertido pudo aprender lo necesario para que ella misma emprenda su propio negocio razón por la cual ahora tiene su propio taller desde ahí atiende los requerimientos de sus clientes quienes afortunadamente se han ido incrementado con el paso del tiempo. Lleva realizando esta labor desde hace 5 años y ocasionalmente recibe la ayuda de otra señora cuando tiene pedidos de mayor envergadura.Lo que le gusta de su actividad es que puede contar con un ingreso económico con el cual poder solventar los gastos del hogar.En está oportunidad solicitará S/. 300 soles, por tanto agradece a todas las personas que hacen posible su acceso al préstamo que necesita para cumplir con sus objetivos laborales.Con el monto solicitado comprará materiales como hilos, agujas, botones, telas, forros y blondas para continuar confeccionando prendas de vestir.
texts.en: Tania is 42 years old, married, and has two children.  She lives in her own home together with her family, and what she most desires is to be able to work in order to generate the resources that will enable her to enjoy her future and a peaceful old age.  Tania works as a seamstress.  She designs, creates and alters different items of clothing such as blouses, pants or shirts according to the needs of the client.  She learned this work from the time she was young because she helped her cousin in a business. Thanks to that time invested she was able to learn the necessary skills so that she herself could begin her own business.  For that reason she now has her own shop and from there she attends to the requirements of her customers who fortunately have been growing in number with the passage of time.  She has been working in this field for five years and occasionally she receives help from another woman when she has very large requests.  What she likes about this activity is that she can count on the economic income with which she can manage household expenses.  At this time she is asking for 300 Soles (Peruvian currency).  She thanks everyone who makes this loan possible so that she can meet her work goals.  With the requested loan, she will buy materials like thread, needles, buttons, fabric, lining, and lace.

loans.use: To buy materials like thread, needles, buttons, fabric, lining, and lace.

loans.name: Josefa

texts.en:
Josefa is a retail store owner and sells grocery items to the people in her village daily. She usually earns 300 PHP (Philippines pesos) each day. She utilizes her earning as revolving capital in the business and for the daily food intake for her family. 

She is now asking for a loan of 25,000 PHP to buy more merchandise to offer. She will buy canned goods, eggs, breads, soft drinks and vegetables to sell. In the future, Josefa hopes to keep improving her sales to gain good revenue for the improvement of her small business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, eggs, breads, soft drinks and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Ellen

texts.en:
Ellen is 43 years old, married, and has one child.  She lives in Upper Centro, Tudela. Ellen sells snacks in the community, which she has been doing for three years. 

Ellen is requesting a loan from PMPC, which she will use to purchase additional ingredients such as flour, sugar, oil, etc. In the future, she hopes to provide for her family's daily needs.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients such as flour, sugar, and oil.

loans.name: Shinedavaa

texts.en:
Mr. Shinedavaa, 68 years old, lives with his wife in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. His son lives separately from his parents. He and his wife have retired from their respective work and get state pensions. His income consists of his pension and rental fees. The building company which operates nearby his house pays the rental fee to him because that part of land belongs to him. His son makes his living from a sales business. 

He is requesting a loan of 3,000,000 MNT (Mongolian tugriks) to purchase an electric car. Electric cars contribute to cleaner air in cities because they produce no harmful pollution at the tailpipe from the onboard source of power, such as particulates (soot), volatile organic compounds, hydrocarbons, carbon monoxide, ozone, lead, and various oxides of nitrogen. His main purpose for purchasing an electric car is to render taxi services to local people as an additional income source because his family needs aren't met with their income. The borrower is a very hardworking individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to purchase an electric car.

loans.name: Aurelia

texts.en:
Aurelia is married with five children. Aurelia is 59 years old and lives in Maras, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte, Philippines.

Aurelia is a farmer and grows rice grains and corn to earn a living. She has been doing this for 41 years. She has requested a loan to buy fertilizers for her grown crops and insect killer materials. 

Aurelia has been a member of PMPC for almost six years. In the future, Aurelia hopes that she can buy another field that she can use to plant other types of root crops.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and insect killer materials.

location.town: Sindangan - Maras, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Jose Rumaldo

texts.es:
José, vive con su esposa y sus dos hijos, los cuales tienen edades de 14 y 15 años, también un nieto. El se dedica al cultivo de granos básicos, crianza de cerdos y aves de corral; este oficio lo aprendió de sus padres desde muy pequeño, hoy en día son sus hijos los que le ayudan a llevarlo a cabo, la ventaja que tiene es que la cosecha es ayuda para la familia y para venderla.
El crédito que requiere le permitira comprar abono, insecticidas, plaguicidas, herbicidas, pesticidas y asimismo para adquirir concentrado para los cerdos; este le ayudara a obtener una mejor cosecha en el cultivo y uno de los riesgos seria un invierno escaso de lluvia.
Su sueño es darle una mayor calidad de vida a su familia y aspira tener ganado en el futuro para así obtener mayores ingresos.
texts.en:
José lives with his wife and two children, ages 14 and 15. He also has a grandchild. José cultivates basic grain crops and also raises pigs and poultry. He learned this trade from his parents at a very young age. Today his children help him carry out his work. This is advantageous during harvest time since his family helps him with gathering and selling the crops.

The loan he is requesting will be used to buy compost, insecticides, fungicides, herbicides, pesticides, as well as concentrated feed for his pigs. This will help him obtain a better harvest from his crops. One of the risks that he must deal with would be the lack of rain during the winter.

His dream is to provide a better quality of life for his family, so he aspires to earn more income in the future.

loans.use: to buy compost, insecticides, fungicides, herbicides, pesticides, as well as concentrated pig feed.

loans.name: Jovelyn

texts.en:
Jovelyn is 39 years old, married, and has two children.  She runs a variety store within her locality, which she has been doing for 12 years. Her husband works as a farmer.The couple aspires to improve their sources of income.

Jovelyn is requesting a loan for 5,000 PHP, which she will use to buy grocery items such as eggs, cooking oil, detergent soap and soft drinks. She plans to have stocks of commodities in her store so that she can lessen her transportation expenses going to and from the market.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items such as eggs, cooking oil, detergent soap, and soft drinks

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en: Elsie is a farmer aged 45 and married. His family lives at Dalaoig, Alcala, Cagayan. Elsie and his wife plant and harvest rice to sell. Elsie usually gains about 20,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) each harvest season. Their income supplements their daily food intake, other daily expenditures in their house such as the electric bill, and school fees. Elsie wanted to gain more income and improve crop growth; that is why he is now asking for a loan of 50,000 PHP to buy fertilizers and insecticides for his farming activity. Elsie hopes to maintain a fruitful harvest for the overall welfare of his family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and insecticides for his farming activity.

loans.name: Elsie's Group

texts.en:
Elsie is 40 years old, married, and has two children.  She lives in Matugas Bajo, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. Elsie is has a snack and food selling business.  She earns approximately 1,500 PHP each month. 

Elisie is requesting a loan from PMPC, which she will use to redeem her pawned parcel cocoland. In the future, she hopes to expand her business.  

Elsie is the leader of a two-person group.  Each member of the group has her own business.

loans.use: To be used in redeeming their pawned parcel cocoland

loans.name: Hussain

texts.en:
